Friendly staff (even let us pay with credit card as we had no cash), free basket of chips and salsa. 

The highlight, was definitely the soup, the tripe and the pozole. They came in a gigantic bowl, filled to the brim, with plenty of meat in the soup, in fact, LOTS of meat. The soup came with sides of chili flakes, herbs, onion, cilantro, and lime, so you can season it to taste

will definitely be back!
author: Long C.

description:
Since Gallardos moved two blocks away, I have found myself here very often. Everything is as delicious as the first time. Thank God because good authentic Mexican food is hard to find in SF. Coming from SoCal I am used to a specific flavor, spice etc. 

Seeing as I am about to jump on a plane to the S Pacific, where there may only be "count on one hand" Mexican places, it was a must that I stop in!

A must in the Mission.
author: Jaylena P.

description: The pozole here is so yummy.  Best place I've found in the bay area by far.
author: Janell W.

description: Food was solid. Got belittled for not having cash. Food wasn't worth that. If they only want cash they should post a sign and not be rude
author: Luke R.

description: There good is not that great and the service was poor. It took them forever to take my order. I went over to the counter to place an order and the waitress told me to return to my seat. Perhaps I wouldn't have needed to rise from my chair if I wasn't kept waiting for so long.
author: Estefania M.

description:
2nd time here; the food is ok. The 1st time i came it was super crowded and we had to wait for a table. This time, it was only 1/3 occupied. Not sure why. Lunch hour. Ordered grilled camarones. took a while for the food to come. Good sized portion of camarones. I had forgotten to tell them i wanted black beans, so after my plate came, i asked for black beans but it never came. We decided to just leave and let it go.

No birria or tostada de ceviche. May try a diff place down the block next time.
author: Tiffany W.

description: It was 11:30 AM and time to hang out with the boys for lunch. The place was with a few customers so it was easy to get a table. I ordered a large beef soup. The meat was still on the bone, the corn was soft, and the broth was hot. I used the homemade salsa on the beef and it was HOT!! The soup is $9.00 for a large and $8.00 for a small. When I come back here next time, I will definitely try something different.
author: Larry W.

description: Hands down my favorite place to sit down with friends and have great mexican food at even better prices ("am I dreaming" type prices).  The staff is consistent and smiley.  It is my second favorite place to bring people when they visit me in the Mission.  Cha Cha Cha is my #1 Fav.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Being Mexican we are very picky about Mexican food places but this place is Great Authentic Mexican Food! A must when in San Francisco!
author: Omar R.

description: This might be my favorite place to eat in San Francisco. It's cheap enough to eat here regularly, the service is always friendly, and the food is great. The soups (caldo de res, menudo) and their combo plates are the standouts. They do seem like they're understaffed all the time so they're a little frantic but they always take care of customers in a pretty timely fashion. Came here once near my birthday and the owner overheard that it was my birthday so he brought out a birthday plate of flan, plantains, and a palm tree made from a carrot, oranges, and a green pepper as the leaves. It was awesome.
author: Young L.

description: HANDS DOWN BEST MEXICAN RESTAURANT I EVER BEEN TOO!!! My bf and i always order enchiladas verdes and I swear to god this is the ONLY place they know how to make them perfect. My only concern is that this place is a little small for the amount of people they get on the weekends (it gets PACKED!) But i guess that just tells you how popular this place is, the people there are SUPER nice and the food is great. What more could you ask for?
author: Alyssa R.

description:
Great happy friendly service & good food , we had Pozole & pork with green chili sauce both excellent 
Note only beer & wine 
On the weekends they serve Goat
author: Rodney H.

description: Excellent family restaurant in SF! They were quickly able to accommodate a large group. The Coctel de Camaron was excellent! Great service and great food!
author: Emily M.

description: Love the breakfast here. Cant go wrong with anything you order. Fresh made corn tortillas were soooo good. Small place with little seating inside and outside seating. Definitely worth the wait.
author: Tina M.

description: Over more than a dozen visits the food has been consistently great. The servers have sometimes been harried but always friendly and welcoming. When we celebrated a friend's birthday with dinner at Gallardos the owner made a wonderful fuss over us.
author: Tom W.

description:
Make moves.

Captivating mural: http://www.artandarchitecture-sf.com/make-moves-mural.html

Captivating cuisine: http://www.sfgate.com/restaurants/bargainbites/article/Gallardos-back-in-business-5125056.php

Visited the original location once for breakfast. Came back twice more to the new location for:

-  Lunch: Enormous torta packed with grilled chicken (bit of skin), onions, lettuce, tomato and avocado. Delicious $8 deal. Cheese and sour cream are standard too.

- Dinner: Impressive serving of shrimp complemented by an impressive serving of tomatoes, onions, bell peppers, carrots and zucchini. Impressive taste too.

Last one comes with beans (great to see black beans were an option), avocado, rice and tortillas. $15 for what could have been two meals was very worthwhile.

Red tablecloths and yellow walls give the new space a bright and festive feel. Staff was friendly and attentive. Roving band of musicians was a nice tough.

Plan to make a move here.
author: Jason B.

description: Simply delicious. I drive from Sacramento to have breakfast here, or it's part of my must-stop places every time I'm in the city. Reminds me of my grandma's food.
author: Juan G.

description:
I've been looking for a place where it has the Mexican soup I had before (Yes, I thought there was only one type of soup in Mexican cuisine). And, I found this place on Yelp last weekend. 

OMG, I am glad that I found it. Why? because there are actually various types of soup in Mexican cuisine. HAHA, and, I just found out. 

I had the Pozole which was pork meat and hominy beans. There was lots of cilantro and union came on the side. I put almost the whole bowl of them in the soup. And then, I had my first bite/sip. AWWWWWW...SO GooooooOOOOD. I never thought Mexican soup can be so rich and complex. of course, it was delicious at the same time. 

In addition, the waitresses were so nice and friendly. 

Highly recommend this place if you want some Mexican soups. I would definitely come back to this place to try other soups and dishes (Their rice plates looked great, too). 

P.S. the front of the store look so sketchy and not inviting, but don't let it fool you. The inside was open, clean, and neat. 

=)
author: Evan L.

description: Gallardos is awesome. They make great chilaquiles, albondigas, pozole and potato dishes, among other things. We've been here tons. Kind of surprised by the alert on their Yelp page, so unless there's been some drastic change in how they run their business, I wanted to vouch for them as a long-time customer and say that this place has made my day for many years.
author: monica d.

description: Birria and Menudo on weekends -- come early they often sell out by noon. Chilaquilla are phenomenal (best I've ever had). Friendly helpful service. And fresh squeezed OJ. Highly recommend. Don't understand negative reviews below.
author: Daniel W.

description: My favorite burrito spot in the mission.  Best machaca burrito in town.  Comes with delicious salsa that burns just right.  The other delicious things here are the tostada and posole.
author: Dan P.

description: Best Birria(Lamb soup) "al horno" in the Bay. They only have it on the weekends though.
author: Sergio M.

description: Rica comida!! Fast and friendly service. Homemade tortillas with delicious birria. Definitely try this place
author: Sandy C.

description:
Food here is really awesome and the family works so hard to make it good.
Stick with the true Mexican food like Pozole.
author: Trecker J.

description: was looking for a snack bite before heading over to Flour + Water later on. 3:30 and the place is packed with families and extended families and lots of happy kids. Walked in and then it hit me....this use to be Chava's. The vibe is still there. Great food. Breakfast served all day. The refried beans are some of the best I've ever had. Nopales and eggs--yum! They had a serious run on the guacamole, so couldn't try it. Will be back.
author: K T.

description:
Been there once.  Got the chicken enchiladas w/green sauce.  Yum!  Salsa that came w/chips was excellent -- first time it was hot enough for me w/out losing other flavors.

Itchin' to go back!
author: Chet M.

description:
Pozole Review


I always had bad decision choosing the right menu.
On yelp, it seemed to me that the most popular food was pozole and menudo. 
So i tried it and it was  awesome!!


Comes with very big size
Absolutely deep taste of the soup
Pork is soft and tender
Fresh and that stunning kick of the salsa sauce!


What more can i say?
author: Stanley Y.

description: This is my 2nd top fave place to go In the mission the caldos here are the best super clean and very friendly staff I will deff return
author: melisa r.

description:
Stopped in this morning for breakfast, as they turned on the lights.

Food was very good, and service couldn't be friendlier. 

Breakfast burrito was huge, and outstanding.

Will make it one of my regulars.

Update 12/29/14

Disappointing meal last night. Chili Verde was dried out, and tortillas were dry and hard. Will try them again, but pick a different meal.
author: Terry L.

description:
Wow!!! This place is bomb!!! Authentic Mexican food! Just like grandma's cooking!  And portions are huge!!

We came on a rainy night...ordered some pozole and boy are they generous with all the fixings! It was delicious!!! 

For our main dishes, Carne Asada Burrito and the Camarones al Mojo de Ajo which came with refried beans, rice and salad...the meat in the burrito was so tender and flavorful! And the shrimp was so juicy and succulent. 12 Large pieces too! I was surprised to see that many pieces! 

Before the food comes out, they give you fresh tortilla chips and a jar of salsa!  It was pretty spicy. Luckily we love spice so it wasn't a big deal to us. But seriously, my mouth was burning while i wanted more and more! Ahaha It was so good we used it on our main dishes too! 

I only deduct a star because there was just one lady working the entire dining area! She greeted you at the door, took your order, brought your food, and bussed the tables!!!  I do give it to her!! She always had a smile on her face and a good attitude.   But if you needed more water, napkins, or your check, it was hard to wave her down. Actually, just watching her do all that work by herself, we patiently waited...a while.


This place is a great place to take your friends and family! Highly recommend this place. I plan to come back on a weekend when they have their menudo on the menu!  Can't wait!
author: Candice V.

description: This place hits the spot. Coming from San Diego, where the Mexican border is just a short 10 min drive, its really hard to find great authentic Mexican food any where else. San Fransisco as my second home, so far hasn't impressed me with great Mexican dishes till the one day I got sick and in my head I heard my mom say" eat some soup" mija!!! Thank you to who ever cooked the amazing Pozole at Gallardos! Not only did I feel ten times better, but felt like I was eating Pozole from my grandmas kitchen with just the right amount of chile rojo. So fresh and Yummy! Im coming back for more!
author: Michelle Q.

description: They were really accommodating to my weird dietary restrictions and made a deconstructed burrito, which was decent. Cute, clean place. Honest food.
author: Andrew K.

description:
hey yelpers...
I been coming here for years they started on 14th. st. this is the best Mexican restaurant in san Francisco.. every plate you get is authentic Mexican cuisine off the hook. since im Mexican I get only a few things I love getting that I don't cook at home often. 1) Birria (goat meat) with all the topping very good for hang overs you can get it in soup form or oven cooked with a side of the broth which I prefer cause you can make tacos and dip your taco in the soup cant go wrong plus HANDMADE corn tortillas my favorite 2)tampicana which is rice, beans (topped with cheese), a piece of steak, chilaquilles (ripped tortilla with red sauce and an egg mixed in it topped with cheese) and one enchilada. its a big plate and goes for about 15 bucks cant go wrong with tht you get alittle of everything. 3)menudo (tripe soup) cant go wrong if your  tripe lover this is for you GREAT for hangovers. theres for my three main dishes I get I have tasted the seafood plates too they are good. I mostly go on the weekends because that's when the birria and menudo are served only. there pozole is also on point and they have that everyday. hope this was helpfu
author: Rigoberto C.

description: I came here for the chillequelles and was a bit disapointed.  Sauce was bland and probably canned.
author: Dennis W.

description: Wife had the chilaquiles for brunch and she says they were pretty bland. The sauce wasn't noticeable and the egg was flavorless. Or get juice was super pulpy so beware if you're not into pulp. I found it delicious however.3.5 stars is more appropriate but I'll give it a 4 for the service.
author: Alex D.

description:
I read the reviews once we walked in. So, I decided to order the pozole and a carne asada taco. What a great decision! With the pozole, you get to add your own lime, cilantro, fresh onions, chili and herbs. It was the best pozole I ever experienced! The taco was so worth the money. It was a huge portion, and it was delicious. They offer a side plate for free with a large helping of sides for your taco; too much for me, but useful if I was more hungry.

For $10, there were enough leftovers for me to take home, and feed the family. What a great deal for the price and the taste, and the customer service was uber fantastic! I loved my experience and meal. I can't wait to return!
author: Rosie M.

description: Eating here was the right thing at the right time. Great weather for an outdoor table. Had the tampiqueña with the chicken enchilada and a Negra Modelo. So. Much. Food.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Cabbed it here with my ladies after a long night of drinking.. and boy were we in for a surprise! The people sitting next to us payed our tab!

Food: Chorizo and Eggs, beans and rice.. with homemade torillas . 5 stars!
          Pozole- 10 stars
          Quesadilla: 5 stars

Micheladas: mmm just right! 4 stars.

Service: was a little slow taking our order but the food came out pretty quickly! Place was getting packed as time got closer to noon.  

Definitely would come back :)
author: Melissa G.

description:
This review is for the shrimp mojo de ajo plate. 
The shrimp was absolutely delicious however the rice and beans were luke warm. This is totally unacceptable. I didn't complain because maybe it was a fluke seeing all these reviews. 

I went back a second time, I specifically and POLITELY asked "can you please make sure the rice and beans is hot cause last time they were lukewarm"

The rice and beans came back lukewarm...as a customer do I really have to ask you to warm up the fucking food? I'm always a nice person especially to people who work in food and I was a nice person in the moment but my USD will never be spent here. 
Pathetic.
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
I've been eating Mexican for a long time. Then I discovered this place and realized I'd been eating a cheap imitation all along. Silly, silly boy. This place is right out of a neighborhood in Old Mexico. No pretension or attitude. Just honest, hearty and authentic food. They've got you covered from breakfast to dinner. 

I had the chile verde burrito. The menu says this is a "tender pork in green sauce." I don't think that captures the bliss contained inside the flour tortilla. "Beyond tender pork with heavenly verde sauce and a touch of cream sauce drizzled on top for extra temptation by the devil himself". That's how I would describe this wonder of creation.

I will be returning frequently. The sopas look fantastic. They have tripe soup and lamb soup on weekends. It's nice to know where I will be eating for sometime to come.

To your health amigos!
author: Jahan T.

description: Quite surprised that this place has a 4-star. Came here because it was right next to my dance studio. Was extremely unimpressed by the unflattering plate of steak, rice and mashed beans. This place is also not air-conditioned and have quite a number of huge flies. Definitely won't be coming back again.
author: Vivien S.

description: The food was great, there was no long wait and people there were very friendly. I had one of the combinations and will probably not have to eat for three days.
author: Luisa H.

description: Let's just say if their customer service matched their food I would have given them 5 stars. It was a Sunday and I know they get pretty busy. Asking us to sit at a table that wasn't cleaned off and when she did clean it, she didn't ask what we wanted to drink and walked away. No drinks, no utensils and no menu. The table next to us ordered, and got their food and we still were not asked for drinks. So I had to get up and ask. All we were going to order were 2 menudo and a quesadilla. By that time other people were walking in getting their orders. We were still waiting to even get our drinks. The table that did order next to us finished their meal and we still did not get our food. It seemed that people who were coming in after us were getting their food and we were being ignored so we walked out. I'm pretty upset to see that it seems that maybe their friends and family who come in get special treatment while others are still waiting.
author: Kristi V.

description:
If you want great mexican food, this is it. I mean real mexican food - when the place is packed with mexicans, you know its real and its excellent!

I had the chilaquiles and it was incredible - the eggs were cooked perfect, the tortillas cut right. Very flavorful and plenty of it. I had a bite of the birria and it was fantastic - having that next time!

The best part is their salsa/sauce - great flavor and carries a little heat, LOVE it!!

If you don't like this place, you like crap mexican food.
author: Tom C.

description:
I have been going to Gallardos for a few years now and always have a great meal there.  

The service is friendly and the food portions are huge!  I go to Gallardos almost every time I go to eat in the area.  

Three is usually a wait on Saturdays around noon, so I am alway prepared for a bit of a wait.  But they move people through the restaurant pretty quickly, even if there are 10-15 people standing outside the door.  

I'm not sure what their current policy regarding credit cards is -- at the old location on Folsom, it was cash only on weekends.  So, I am always prepared and bring cash.  

Yummy food, good service, good prices,.. you can't go wrong at Gallardos.
author: Suzie Y.

description:
This place was once on 14th and Folsom, but expanded here. Having just reopened, it won't be selling margaritas in the immediate future. But it does serve beer and wine.

The food is delicious. The plates are large. The salsa is the best I've ever had. And the spiciest, so be careful. The beans are not refried. The tortillas are crispy and the owners will come around personally to ask after you. Five stars!
author: Morgan I.

description: Birria De Chivo - one of my favorite dishes to savor when I want to disappear with a book for a few hours. The relocation to 18th was worth the wait. Staff is even more cheerful & friendly in this sunny Mission location
author: Steven B.

description:
I ventured out to the mission for some Mexican hangover helper before heading to SFO to catch my flight back home. The service was very nice and quick. The decor of this place is funny and somewhat creepy, I was the only non-mexican eating there... this is starting out very good. I also noticed everyone was eating Pozole, but I was not in the mood. I opted for some Enchaladas which were decent, but nothing to write home about.... Should have gotten the Pozole!

Next time!
author: Jonah K.

description:
Nothing great here. 

Went to lunch here today and when my plate showed up there was slightly melted squares of American cheese on top.

I had high hopes after reading reviews but this definitely does not need a revisit. It did earn 2 stars for the friendly staff, spicy salsa and the tortillas. 

And the cheese enchilada was also stuffed with American cheese. Really odd for what appeared to be an authentic Mexican restaurant.
author: Kenny D.

description:
I was in the mood for some menudo but couldn't decide where to go. Enter Gallardo's. Never heard of it before but the reviews looked promising. My husband had the menudo and I had the birria. Both of which are only served on weekends. As a Mexican, I am picky when it comes to Mexican food. Also, I always compare it to my mom's and grandma's cooking. Unfair, I know. But I digress. Both soups came with cilantro, onions and limes. As well as oregano and pepper flakes for the menudo. The tortillas were handmade and were delicious. I had the birria al horno, which is just the meat and broth separate. The first spoonful of the broth was like heaven. It was hot and spicy and so full of flavor. I made a taco with the meat, added the onions and cilantro and dipped it in the broth before each bite. Man, was it yummy! I also tried the menudo and it was quite flavorful. The tripe was soft and easy to chew. I was bummed that it didn't have hominy though. I tried the orange-carrot fresh squeezed juice and it was really good. Interesting combo but it worked. My husband had a Mexican bottle coke which was room temp, so that was a bummer. 

The service was bad though. It took a while for our waiter to take our order and only saw him once after he dropped off the food. Had to go up to the counter and ask for a to-go container and the check. I suppose if we had been in a rush I would have been more bothered but we weren't so it didn't matter that much. The line was out the door from the minute we got there to the time we left, so they must be doing something right. 

I will add though that I asked for more broth to go and the waitress was very happy to do so. So that was a plus. I will definitely go back to try the pozole.
author: Norma T.

description:
A MUST MUST MUST try. I have been a regular at this place for years now. Everything on the menu is delicious. 
-Menudo and Birria are amazing
-Chilaquiles are some of the best ever
-Rrefried beans
-Gallardos Platter for appetizer (It's Huge!)
-Fresh homemade tortillas
-Fresh juices

These are just some of my favorite items from Gallardos. One of the best attributes for this place is the service! Down home family service from amazing people. I have never ever had any complaints about this place.
author: Ed S.

description:
Was In bed till about 2 and decided I needed some menudo to cure my hang over. I always forget about GALLARDOS since they have moved but whenever I crave menudo this is the place to go! Their michiladas  are also BOMB
Need some good Mexican food on a Sunday morning or I guess any day of the week come here! The staff is sweet too and I like the feel of all the Mexican families having brunch after church on Sunday! Reminds me of LA ;)
author: Melissa R.

description:
Fool me once shame on you.  Fool me twice shame on me.  

Even in the new spot on 18th and years later, service sucks.  Nothing like getting sat outside for service and then being forgotten about.  The food isn't worth it.  12/21/13.
author: Jimmie L.

description:
Pozole, Pozole, Pozole, Pazole & surprisingly a hamburger or humburguesa if you're into that sort of thing at a Mexican place.

I always order the Pazole..... Clearly.... and it is very good! 3 stars because the owner needs to get their act together and hire some more servers. Or just get rid of the table service. The servers are very nice ladies and are as helpful and attentive as you can be...... 

When there's two of you and about 15 tables! It's not just a bum shift either. Multiple times I've visited I always have to go to the register to get the bill. I hate waiting for the bill, more than I hate getting my food before my drinks.

Only place I've ever just left my money on the table and walked out. Done it twice here after waiting 20mins.

Food is great and so is the service when you're the only one in there.
author: Connor M.

description:
Awesome food, fresh squeezed oj, lovely service. Everyone is always nice in here, food is great and prices aren't bad. It's hard to find a place near mission that is clean, yet here it is.

This time I had the chilaquiles, nice and crispy so you could tell they were just made. Sause wasn't spicy nor sweet :) our server was making my orange&carrot juice right before my eyes, which was so delicious. My bf had huevos rancheros, like the real thing tho. He usually eats slowly, but surprisingly he was done before me both of the times we been here. Service was right on point, coffee refills offered and not pushy on sales. Great brunch place.
author: Hector S.

description:
Awesome food and great service...   The amount of food they give you is ridiculous, in a good way.  All their tortillas seemed homemade and the decor was really cool.

I'll definitely be back.
author: William G.

description:
Love this Mexican restaurant in the city

One word, Pozole! bomb.com I can't get enough of it, trust me I've tried.  Their menu is amazing they have everything you can possibly want and more. The owner and staff are amazing people who make you feel welcome and at home. 

You should check it out you won't regret it.
author: Jennifer R.

description: The pozole is still amazing! The huevos rancheros are bomb.  My husband and mom rave about the menudo and my son loved the shrimp omelette and devoured the bacon cheeseburger. The micheladas are a MUST have! This place is overall amazing and now at the new location it made it even better! A modern twist with all the same fabulous familiar pictures covering the walls. It definitely attracts all types of cultures now too. Not just Latinos. ONLY reason why its still at a four  is b/c of the wait to get your bill at the end. It still only accepts cash too. Kind of inconvenient but the food is way well worth it. Keep it up Gallardo's. We will be back again!!!
author: Carmen C.

description: Fast and friendly service! You won't walk out hungry! My husband and I ordered burritos - chile verde and carne asada along with our six year old - a chicken taco. So good! We will be back when visiting the mission district.
author: Amylynn M.

description: Great Mexican food, long family run business, clean, friendly, as a gringo I love their Pasole and on the weekends their Menudo is worth the 20 mile ride from Redwood City, where there are plenty of Mexican restaurants. A little bit of the beaten path in a residential area a couple of blocks from Mission street but that works fine for me. I've been eating here since their days on Folsom and 14 street which was a beehive of activity and before they were forced to move. Worth checking them out.
author: Jerry M.

description:
At long-last, Gallardos threw open its doors a few weeks ago. I was excited to stop in, not least because it stands where once was Chavas, a true powerhouse of soulful, family-style mexican food, and a restaurant to which the owner is connected.

The clientele is still bustling (long lines on the weekend), and the owner has done a nice job of cleaning up the appearance of the restaurant. 

Sadly, neither I nor my lunch companions could find anything to recommend the actual dining experience:

Service, awkward. 
Food, bland. 
Meat, tough. 
Ingredient quality, poor.
Prices, astronomical. 

This was not only disappointing, but a little surprising, given the high bar established by restaurants along the 18th Street corridor, and healthy competition for Mexican food even in the immediate vicinity. 

Consider these options:

At the same price point, there is Regalito Rosticeria a few blocks down 18th. Well-considered, authentic dishes with a modern touch and wonderful flavors, and warm efficient service.

For a quick, tasty meal, El Tepa has been doing a brisk trade for years on the same block as Gallardos.

And for family-style, "keeping-it-real" food, there's San Jalisco and Los Yaquis a few blocks in either direction on S. Van Ness.

I realize the restaurant is still working things out, and I will definitely give them a second chance in a few months, but so far the decisions I've witnessed look like a recipe for disaster (no pun intended). On the other hand, look at those lines...

Note: The 140+ ratings you see are not for this location.
author: Jay B.

description: I had a menudo with handmade tortillas. It was delicious! The only reason why I didn't give it a 5 starts was because the server can be a bit more attentive.
author: Isela L.

description: Best pozole in town I'm super impressed with the food but not so much on there service but other than than it was worth coming here to eat
author: Anthony A.

description:
THEY ARE OPEN FOR BUSINESS!!!  AS OF OCTOBER 20, 2013

This was one of my go-to places and their new location rocks.  A bit smaller, but cleaner and well decorated.  They brought along their old black and white posters of famous Mexican singers and actors, added a great bold, but tasteful color scheme, and didn't change a thing about the menu.  The staff all came over and Juan is his usual warm and friendly self.  I LOVE this place and highly recommend the Papas con Huevos (potatoes and eggs scramble).  Coffee is strong and good and their service is par excellence.
author: Frank B.

description:
New location very nice, and now there are tables outside for a sunny day.
Had chicken soup...meh, not the best, but a huge portion. Tacos dorados kinda soggy ( pre made shells;  not all fried together the way I like it)
Overall, still a cheap, good meal, and the new venue is really nice compared with the old place. I'll be back, but might wait a month or so until it gets up to speed. Was super busy though on a Saturday afternoon. Everyone else was having Birria and looked really happy.
And the fresh tortillas are still to die for....
author: El B.

description: Gallardo's Mexican Restaurant deserves a 5 star for their Micheladas! It was absolutely delicious! But because that is just a beverage and not the actual food I am giving them 4 stars. My burrito de carne asada was good but not quite memorable. It was a huge portion but I can't say that it was something I would keep getting. I did notice that they added a chile verde on top of it which contained pork. For those who care whether they are eating pork, it is risky for them to do that without warning you first. I try not to eat pork so it bothered me just a little bit but I grew up eating pork and I know good chile verde or chile rojo con puerco when I taste it. This was definitely good!
author: Judith G.

description:
Let's list positives here-
1) Cheap mexican food. 
2) plenty of meat free options. 
3) Everything I've tried is pretty tasty. 

I'm sold, it's right by my work so I'm sure they'll be seeing plenty of me in the future. Another awesome is that they have a breakfast menu in the AM.
author: Jourdain D.

description: I was there for a friend's birthday dinner. Excellent food (The beef soup was delicious), excellent service. This is an amazing, down-to-the earth restaurant!
author: Linda S.

description: The best menudo I've had in the Mission. Flavorful broth with lots of tripe and unctuous bits. The tortillas that come with it are substantial and fresh without being too dense.
author: Jeremy C.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant!!! Everything I've ordered has tasted great!  Breakfast there on Sunday is a must try, but get there early or you'll have to wait for a table.
author: Jeanine M.

description: This goes under the Cheap but Good category. For 10 bucks you can get a full-on meal with all the fixins. The fresh salsa is one of the tastiest around. No hot sauce needed here. These guys know how to season their food. The service is minimal but friendly. It's got a cozy neighborhood feel and it's tucked away from the madness on Mission.
author: William B.

description:
The best authentic Mexican restaurant in San Francisco, and that is quite the compliment, considering that there is probably 1,000 of them in the city.  My friends from Guadalajara say that this is the real thing.  Could serve the best breakfast in the city too.

Beautiful new remodeled location.  Super clean and airy compared to the old dark location.  Old place was dingy, but this place is sparkling new.

Service is great.  If some fool complains that it is slow, it is because the place is so busy.  Today the place was so packed you had to wait for a seat, but I still got my food in less than 7 or 8 minutes.  Juan Gallardo gets to know his customers, super nice guy.  It is so obvious that he doesn't just see the place as a money making business, but he takes real pride in the product...the best Mexican food in San Francisco.  If there is a single thing wrong about your meal, he wants to hear about it.

Service quick, food served quick, huge menu, steaks, seafood, all the standard Mexican fare (but better), and Mexican stews and soups like Birria, Pozole, Menudo. If you like lamb, this birria is thick with it and delicious.


Best omelettes in San Francisco too.  Sometimes I think they put four eggs in them.   The average breakfast there is so huge is is good for two (as are most of their dishes).  Great big glasses of fresh squeezed orange and carrot juice...delicious.  Can't beat the home made tortillas.

Go.  Problem is, if you go there too often, you are gonna get fat.
author: Joe S.

description: Delicious enchiladas and burritos! Very fast and friendly service. Happy to have this place as my go to Mexican spot place for lunch.
author: Chauanh D.

description:
Wasnt feeling well on my birthday but my parents still insisted on taking me out even just for lunch. Gallardos was just around the corner from my mom's office and she swears by it and insisted on going there (even though all I wanted was some congee, so asian, I know). 

So we went in, it was around 1 or 2 pm, so not a lot of people. The place is nice and clean, although I'm sure there are no street parking available during peak hours. Anyway once we sat down, we got complimentary tortilla chips together with some super hot salsa. It was good salsa but it's too hot for my taste, I wish they have a milder version. It wasnt so busy but it was very hard to get the attention of the waiters. I literally had to flag her down so that she can get our order. My mom had the pozole, I had the seafood enchiladas, my sister had the chicken enchilada, and my dad had the steak plate something (I forgot). Orders came in really fast (faster than our waitress getting our orders, heh!). The plates are big and everything was delicious. Since the food was so good, I decided to order dessert (it was my birthday after all). I ordered the flan. It was okay, nothing spectacular. 

So all in all, my review for this joint is:

Food = Great
Price = Even better!!
Service = Eh.. not so much
author: Trisha M.

description: Lunch today. A decent portion of pork pozole for around $8 with all the condiments and homemade corn tortillas. Carne asada con papas is $12 and is filling. The fried plantains are served with crema and beans; I prefer rice. Restaurant is clean and has a great breeze that flows in from the front door. The food served here might be from the states of Jalisco or Michoacán. Many typical Mexican dishes. Server asked if we needed anything; unfortunately we had already finished. Fresh OJ is sweet. Presentation and prep could make a difference as could taste which is on bland side.
author: Mo O.

description: Great casual atmosphere and food at very reasonable prices. Feels like an old-fashioned family run place and made a big effort for my wife's birthday. Thanks!
author: David J.

description: The best of the best, in a hood with outstanding Mexican food. We shared a bacon omelette with fresh squeezed orange juice.
author: Scott B.

description: The posole was excellent but the service was awful.  They said I can seat myself, I get settled in, the staff is just chatting to each other, I believe it's a family.  At some point they catch my eye and realize they haven't even given me a menu and bring one over. They take my order, food comes quickly, she sets it down and asks if I want tortillas, I say yes.  She hollers in spanish to someone behind the wall to the kitchen. She does not follow up, or even check that the person heard her, tortillas never come and they never notice or check on me that they didn't.  When I'm done eating I try to get someone to notice me, finally a man walks by and I catch his attention. He asks if everything is ok? I say the food is great, but I would like a togo box and my check. He yells back to the kitchen something in spanish, and then walks out the door.  No box or check comes. I finally walk to the kitchen and ask for the check and a box which they give me. Thankfully I had the right amount of cash to pay plus some gratuity (I'm just not the type to not tip, can't do it) because no one ever came to take the check from me. I finally just left the cash on the table and left.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Good food but could have used more salt or spices.
Service is slow, had to get up to ask for things.
Most importantly, the music is loud and they invite a random guitarist to come inside and play loud guitar table to table, who then extends a bag to ask for money. So uncomfortable and unwanted. Not what I'd expect from a sit-down restaurant.
author: M. M.

description: Lukewarm, undercooked, dry is what I got.  I know they make awesome food but I guess it's what you order and when.  I hit it on a bad day on top of ordering the "wrong" food.  Sad that this happened.
author: Rona M.

description:
Sunday morning and had a blast the night before...my head is screaming for a comfort cure..I've heard many good things about this place so i think its  good time to try an authentic cure..Caldo! A few of us get together, ready to taste cure.
Our table had had Chiliquiles, Sopa de Res, and so on but it was soooo goood! Even the fresh orange juice was good...(I've had bad fresh orange juice, believe it or not)..
The food was very authentic and very satisfying portions...it was all fresh and ...damn im going back!! See ya
author: shirley c.

description:
Wow! Had no idea this place existed and I pass by all the time! Friend and I scarfed down the albondigas, pozole, chilaquiles and the Carne asada tacos. The broths are so rich with flavor, I can't wait for another rainy day to get soup from here again. The fixings for the soup just gives them the extra oomph! Sad thing is that it's moving farther away from me to 18th street.

Move over pho, there's another bad a$$ sopa in town.
author: Yoko H.

description:
A true taste of the Mission.

I live out of town, but I am now starting to make a stop here part of my semi-annual visit just to get the Menudo.

My kids had egg burritos and I cannot stop eating the Menudo for Sunday breakfast. 

Very nice staff and I feel like I am in a different world here with the crowd and atmosphere. 

You want authentic Mexico, come here.
author: George A.

description: Very yummy place! Best Mexican food I've eaten in San Fran so far. I have loved everything I've tried from here so far. They even specially made a California burrito for my fiancé! Good food and service. Only thing that is not that cool, service gets a little scarce when it's busy. And the minimum for card is $7, which kinda sucks cuz sometimes I just want to buy a drink :(
author: Aiko R.

description: I'd never eaten pozole. Because of the reviews here and the fact I like hominy, I decided to give it a try. Delicious. The broth flavorful and chunks of tender pork. And the sides: tortillas, crema, huge bowl of cilantro and chopped onion, radishes, limes, oregano, chili pepper. The husband had the enchilada platter, and he loved it. Loved the "Mexican coca-cola." Will definitely return.
author: Dennis D.

description: This is the worst "mexican" food I have ever had! I passed by one day and saw the line out the door! It was not because the food is good, it's because the service sucks! Who has one waitress serving the entire restroom at lunch time on a weekday?
author: Cynthia C.

description: The food and staff here are amazing. Everything on the menu is truly delicious. Try the #5! OMGsh!
author: Mary A. J.

description:
Their birria (spicy lamb stew - served weekends only) was utterly delicious! You can enjoy it as soup with hot tortillas on the side or served with beans and rice. Bowls of chilies, onions, chopped cilantro and fresh dried oregano add dimensions. The kids (picky eaters all) polished off large, yummy burritos. Also of note: the fresh orange juice - most tasty I've ever had. And the flan - dense, rich and sinfully good home recipe!

This is a family place. The grandmother came to our table to be sure we were happy with our meals (and to meet our children). The children, grandchildren, nieces and nephews all pitch in. It is a joyful place. The walls are decorated with large b/w posters of Mexican movie and TV stars. 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Cynthia G.

description: The pozole soup was amazing... So much flavor and tender, slow cooked to perfection. Small size was more than enough for two meals!! The carne asada taco was also gigantic and delicious...for only $3.75!! The chips were great, not too oily, perfectly thin and crispy, with of course, the best, spiciest salsa!!!
author: minnie l.

description: Hands down one of the top 3 best Mexican restaurants I've been to. Everything looked so delicious on the tables around me it was so difficult to decide. I ordered the pozole which they ended up running out of by the time we left at about 1 pm which goes to show you how popular it is! My husband could tell when we were eating that the owners were from the same town as him in Guadalajara, Mexico.  The food was identical to that which he grew up eating. Everything was wonderfully delicious. The pozole was flavorful and had accoutrements galore- fresh made tostadas, shredded cabbage, onions, cilantro, fresh juicy lime halves, chile flakes, and a large spoonful of crema on the side, my husband says you're suppose to spread that on the tostada. All of the other soups besides the pozole came with a little side plate of rice and guac, the rice was luscious, some of the best ever. My husband got chilaquiles and everything from the homemade tortillas to the silky yummy beans were fantastic. We couldn't have asked for a better meal, my husband also got a mexican hot chocolate which was soo perfectly made. What was the icing on the cake though was the five star service. These people are not only friendly, fast and efficient but they are genuine. They embody everything wonderful you could ever look for in a dining experience. We can't wait to go back, it's worth having to circle around for parking for 20 mins!
author: Emma H.

description:
First thing first, their pozole is AMAZING! I'm part Mexican and their pozole is just like the one my mom makes! It's absolutely delicious and full of flavor! Their pozole can certainly cure a night of debauchery and too much whiskey. The rest of the food is also amazing, especially their chilaquiles con huevos. They just opened this location, so their definitely working out the kinks but I have a great feeling that they'll get it all together very soon. Another really cool thing is that the owner is there all the time. He's super friendly and you can tell he wants everyone to have an enjoyable experience. I have a lot of respect for restaurant/bar owners that are not afraid to get their hands dirty! 

So, all in all, a great restaurant with wonderful food!
author: Michi R.

description:
This review is only for the soups, specifically the Pozole (rich broth with pork shoulder), Menudo (tripe in clear broth with red chili base), and Birria (spicy Mexican meat stew with goat meat). 

I like all of Gallardos' soups but Pozole is my favorite. The rich broth seems infused with pork goodness.  Each of the soups are slight variations on each other and all delicious! Embarassingly huge portions of steaming broth and tender meat, served with a several bowls of condiments to customize your soup to your heart's content - lime, cilantro, diced white onions, red pepper flakes, and a special mix of herbs. With a side of warm, doughy tortillas...  you can't go wrong!

The perfect hangover remedy and/or satisfying breakfast/brunch on a gloomy SF morning!

Tips: Cash only and dress warm! For some reason, their restaurant always feels drafty to me.
author: Monelle A.

description:
Flan!!!

Very rich, creamy flan. 
Delicious. 
Forget about calories. just eat, and love it.

As far as I know, they take cash only Saturday and Sunday.
Make sure to stop by ATM before head to this place.  

I haven't visited a new location yet, hope they haven't raised a price.
author: Vicki S.

description:
BEST.  POZOLE.  EVER.

And I've had lots.  Just look at me!

Being from LA, I've had some damn good, legit Mexican food...but I gotta say, I think their pozole is one of the best I've ever had.  When you throw in portion size, quality and price, hands down - THE BEST!!!
author: Alex T.

description:
I tried the Pozole and the mole. They were both delicious. The food reminded me of my mother's home cooking. The tortillas were a plus. 

Service here is also great. They are friendly and attentive to their customers. Just remember that this place is cash only.
author: Yurida R.

description:
Fast, friendly service; excellent food; and almost unbelievable prices. I'm glad it's only a couple blocks away. Five us went over about forty minutes before closing time, and were served quickly and were able to linger over the food- no pressure to get out at closing time.
It's hard to beat.
author: Carl C.

description: This place is the perfect sit-down Mexican food restaurant. Not the best food ever, but cheap and ample and the people are really nice.
author: Melville M.

description:
As I biked down 14th Street on a recent Sunday morning, I chuckled to myself at the mass of bodies lingering, hungrily, outside MBC.

We opted away from fancy brunch cocktails and $12 egg dishes and all-in for a hearty, no-frills-just-the-good-stuff breakfast. 

Weekends are cash only, but who cares when you can rock massive plates of Huevos con Nopales (scramble, also available as omelette) and Huevos Rancheros, each for $6.75. Add a buck and a half for coffee.

Full breakfast many with too many options. Most served with tortillas, some with beans (& cheese), and "garnished" with tender, moist chunks of pork on the side. Who needs a parsley sprig when you can have pork?!?

Add a fresh glass of carrot or orange juice or even a beer.

Service is prompt, despite the place being packed to the brim.

I was reminded what makes brunch so amazing - and it's nothing fancy. Be it the brunch that undoubtedly could cure any hangover or the catching up with old friends, it surely satisfied.
author: Alissa A.

description: Great food, great atmosphere . The food service was fast and good. Good prices. Great Mexican food!
author: Malinda R.

description:
After walking by and spying the black and white photographs of Mexican cinema stars on the walls I thought I'd give this place a shot for brunch. The restaurant exudes a friendly and unpretentious ambiance, as most Mexican restaurants do, displaying an open prep area on the right hand side. Thought it strange that they sat the two of us at a table capable of sitting eight, all alone despite the line out the door--in fact, felt uncomfortable enough that when a party of five asked to move to a larger table near them I asked if we could relocate to their vacated table. This was an early indicator that the management suffers a few organizational obstacles in the running of their restaurant. The wait staff looked run off their feet, bringing me a Diet Coke instead of the coffee I ordered (huh?), and then taking a good while to remember the coffee. 

THAT SAID: The food is very tasty. Fluffy tortillas tasted fresh. The flautas I ordered were crispy and not at all greasy, topped with a dollop or two of sour cream and queso and garnished with crispy lettuce. My girlfriend's dish was a standout, the caldo de pollo (chicken soup). Came with two meaty drumsticks, large chunks of carrot, zucchini, and a side dish of cilantro, onion and peppers to add in. Coffee was so-so. 

That the restaurant is cash only (a fact I hadn't comprehended), was a small unpleasant surprise. All in all, a very decent meal--but a place I am not all that eager to return to.
author: Brian G.

description: I just got into town and was extremely hungry when I walked into this fine establishment. I ordered the daily special and got it quick, but it was extremely bad, even after not eating for the whole day. They also don't accept credit cards and could not provide me with a receipt, although I directly asked for it (reimbursement, on a business trip). Do not repeat my mistake and try to eat there.
author: Anton T.

description: Most of the soups are good, but I tried the shrimp soup and it was disgusting.  The worst part was that the shrimps where not cleaned at all.  I had to devein the shrimps myself.  They where crunchy due to the fullness of their intestinal tract (disgusting) which is why I tasted a lot of dirt in my mouth. When I told the waitress she said that most places don't clean them.    I was very disappointed.
author: Pablo H.

description:
I went to Best Buy with my sister and her kids and, as usual, they were hungry. Geez, those kids want to eat every day! So I yelped into my iphone app and found this Gallardos place. We walked over and were greeted by a very friendly lady. Since we were in "The Mission" I figured I would ask if this place was cash only. I thought it may not be since it is actually a sit-down kind of restaurant. The lady told me that Monday - Fridays they take credit and debit cards but on the weekends they usually try to keep it cash only. They were willing to make an exception for us but I went across the street to the grocery store to get some cash just in case. 

I really liked the feel of this restaurant. There are large framed photographs of Mexican film stars from the black and white era. The photos reminded me of when I was a kid and my family would watch those old black and white movies on Sundays when they would come on the Spanish tv channels. There is also a jukebox so you can find your favorite musica.

The servers gave us a few minutes and then came by to take out orders. In the meantime they brought us complementary guacamoWe were a little sad to find out that they didn't have "aguas frescas". They did have a nice selection of Jarritos, so the kids were happy. I ordered a michelada. They have a good selection of Mexican type beers. I asked for Negra Modelo in mine. Two of the kids ordered cheeseburgers, my sister and oldest nephew had the super carne asada burrito and I had the vegetarian burrito. In case you don't know (I didn't know until I was here and asked), making the burrito super means that you are adding guacamole and sour cream. 

The burgers came with French fries just as they should at any respectable mexican restaurant. The kids loved it. They're still easy to please.

The burritos were HUGE. The beans had a good flavor, but it threw me off that they put lettuce all up in my tortilla. is that normal?my sister and nephew liked their carne asada burritos, those carnivores that they are. 

So everything was good and the prices are really low considering it is a sit-down place. My burrito was about $5 and the carne asada burritos were like $6.50. 

Before we left, my sister ordered fresh squeezed orange juice to go. so yeah, they don't have aguas frescas but they can make fresh squeezed orange juice. 

i think next time i would like to try the pozole or something else, although I probably won't be back unless I need to go to best buy and find myself in this part of town.
author: Daisy S.

description: first off, i have no idea how this place got more than a star.  place is soo cramped and soo busy.  when the place is busy, it usually means its good. NOT!!! we ordered menudo and shrimp cocktail and the food was highly disappointing!!!!  the service:  i usually tip, and i base it on the service I received.  took them almost 30 mins to get my food after everyone else got theirs.  bf menudo didnt come w tortilla and we had to ask for it.  our waitress was obviously too busy to serve us.  I don't know the hype, but i know for sure ill never come back.
author: Vernz G.

description:
Yum Yum Yum Pozole, Menudo, Caldo, Chorizo, Huevoes Rancheros....

Given how many people we go with and how many times we've been I've sampled more than my fair share of dishes here. They're all super delicious and homemade tasting. My mexican husband says that the menudo is closest thing he's found to the menudo his grandmother used to make. 

My favorite is the hot chocolate. Yummmm Mexican hot chocolate I don't have to make at home....

Even their oatmeal is ridiculously good!

And while their prices are all reasonable, beware, it's cash only on the weekends.
author: Sydney T.

description: Me and my friends were walking around the mission because we found out that the place we originally were planning to eat (Ken Ken Ramen) only served ramen after 6 pm! We stumbled upon Gallardos and decided to eat here.I had the super steak burrito and it was one of the best burritos I've ever had! It was really filling (I could barely finish it) and it was only $7.50. They also gave us complimentary chips and salsa and had live music!
author: Trisha L.

description: One of my favorite lunch spots! Great service and awesome food! Family run and owned. I have also seen them give food to people in need - pretty cool folks!
author: Alexis R.

description: Had Birria on a Saturday to cure my hangover and it was great. They give you a LOT of lamb. The broth was delicious with freshly chopped onions and cilantro. Their tortillas are delicious! I'd recommend getting their soup -- other dishes were good, but not amazing. We also had their flan which tasted more like thick cheesecake (not complaining). Service was friendly and we got lucky and saw a band play, too. Would go back when I have my next hangover, which inevitably won't be too long from now.
author: Michelle K.

description: Great flavor and portions are more than adequate! Family run and delicious! Wide menu options for all!
author: Javier C.

description: service was 5star. super friendly. oj was dark orange fresh squeezed amazingness. tortillas made fresh, so effing good. salsa could have been better but not bad, they have hot and mild options. great place for authentic brunch. good seating nice vibe if/when they play music. coffee is not so good but bottomless. cash only.
author: K R.

description: Food is amazing I love every single thing I have tried here. So welcoming when I walk in every time and great food at reasonable prices.
author: Melissa R.

description: Great place to go with my family. Definitely one of our favorite restaurants ! The food is always great and the customer service is excellent , and the food is always fresh and delicious . Seating is comfortable for big groups. We always come back, Highly recommended
author: Vilma R.

description:
My brother and i had $21 between the both of us, and this was cash only.

We left having eaten a bit too much, and still a few dollars in our pocket. I'm ready to go back to try other things on the menu.
author: Ameer N.

description: I love this place. The food is awesome and at a reasonable price. This is truly a family owned business. Super Clean and friendly. I read a previous comment how ever I have paid with my card many times at Gallardos. I do think there is a minimum amount. If you are looking for great taste with little money try there tostadas.
author: Carolyne R.

description: Very good food, but the best service,  simple and really authentic,  the burrito was literally the best I ever had.
author: Donny M.

description: I say this every time I come:  it's not just the best Mexican in San Francisco; it's some of the best food in the city. Period. Make sure you get some tortillas.
author: Lucas M.

description:
I love this place.  It's definitely my favorite restaurant of this type (basic Mexican food) in the Bay Area.  I might be tempted to give it five stars but, as a frequent visitor to Mexico, I know that food of this type can be even more impressive.  Unfortunately, I don't have a superpower whereby I can just transport myself to a beach side restaurant in Puerto Vallarta for lunch, though, so when I'm in the mood for some good Mexican food I'll head here when I can.

It's also good that their portions are generous and the prices are reasonable.

The staff is also extremely nice, even when they are super busy.  I'm not even THAT much of a regular now that their space is several blocks farther away from where I live and they still treat me like family when I dine here.
author: Jeff S.

description: Totally good and not too crowded for a Saturday brunch, at least on the day I went. I had the menudo which had great flavor and was the 'right size' for me. (Not gigantic, not small by any stretch.)  My friend had the ....errr...I think it was the Machaca. (Shredded beef w/scrambled eggs) which was REALLY good. The beef tasted better and was more tender than other places and the onions were really well grilled.  Bonus: This is not a 'taqueria', it's a sit down restaurant (though not fancy) with table service and high ceilings. Good mix of 'authentic' cuisine and 'clean' if you're introducing parents or out of towners to SF's fine Mexican food.
author: David P.

description: Friendly folks running this place, but with so much great Mexican food in the city, they need to up their game with their food quality.  My wife got the seafood enchiladas, and she was disappointed with the American cheese used on it.  I had a veggie burrito that was pretty dry and unspectacular.  They could get away with this quality if they were in a small town somewhere, but not in SF.
author: Troy S.

description: Great food.  Service is solid.  Crispy tacos were delicious.  Shredded chicken and pork.  Prices were reasonable.  Ambiance was great.
author: Zach H.

description:
Can I just give this place another 5 stars because i've gone back 5 times in 2 weeks for their pozole??!@?!!!!!

thanks
author: Natalie L.

description: Just had the most pleasurable morning this past Saturday @ Gallardos. Friendly service and an ample plateful of shredded, crispy-edged birria with a tomato-chile home cooked broth for DIPPIN. The kind of food your grandma cooked. Great stuff.
author: Anthony R.

description: Homestyle comfort food--nothing fancy, and no really strong flavors. Like a much better version of San Jalisco. I tried chile relleno, pork tacos, and milanesa. It was all good, but the competition in this neighborhood is fierce, so it's hard to imagine coming here when better Mexican abounds. Also, service was pretty minimal.
author: Mike B.

description: Gallardos is a really special place. The huevos rancheros totally blew me away. I had thought I knew what a good plate of huevos rancheros was before coming here, but I didn't. So good.
author: Robert S.

description: Best service I have received at a restaurant. Huge portions and amazing food. I really liked their menudo and chilaquiles. Recommend this place to people. It's always packed each time I come here
author: Nick G.

description:
this place has it's highs and lows.  more recently more lows then highs.  
I think it was long hair in my partner's soup which can be a real turn off.
author: Princess P.

description: Our visit went from bad to worse. Although, it's crowded due to popularity, this restaurant hasn't figured out how to move customers and service along. We waited at least 30 minutes to be served, then only to find out they had completely forgotten my father's plate. When it was brought out, it was the wrong meal, which we returned. It finally came, so by that time we took it to go. Then, you'd think the wait staff would be courteous for the error - wrong. They got rude. The meal wasn't even comp'd - I am always glad to pay and I do consider myself an above average tipper, never looking for a hand-out, but this was the last straw. I am never going there again and I will not recommend Gallardo's to anyone. There are far better Mexican restaurants in SF to be had.
author: Lilian P.

description: We went to Glass All down the street to drop off the car (after the window was smashed earlier that morning in the Mission Dolores) and then tried out Gallardos for breakfast.  We were the only people in the place at the time, but I think it's because it was a weekday.  Also, I noticed most reviews are about there lunch / dinner foods.  Well, this one is about yummy breakfast.  This place is solid.  The food was tasty, the service was friendly and very attentive, the portions were big, and the prices were great.  I think most breakfast dishes are served with beans and rice.  My husband's came with tortillas too.  The coolest part was that when I opened my leftovers the next day, I realized that they had packed an extra scoop of the beans.  I guess because I had done such a job at devouring them.  This was too cool!  Thanks : )
author: Alexis B.

description: The food is great the michelada 's are good the only bad thing is finding parking but other than that it's a good place to stop by.
author: Miguel A.

description: Authentic Mexican and delicious at an affordable price. Had the Shrimp cocktail which was delicious. Just the right amount of spice with big juicy shrimp. My friend had a burrito such was the largest I have ever seen. The tamarindo was home made and a perfect blend of sour and sweet. Even the chips and salsa were fresh and tasty. Been wanting to try this place for a while even when it was at the other location. Glad I finally did . Definitely on my list of good authentic Mexican food
author: Matt A.

description: Really delicious food at great prices with big portions. Very friendly staff and a nice atmosphere. Couldn't have better things to say about this place.
author: Aaron A.

description:
I got four items here: nopalitos con huevos, pozole, carne asada, and the cheeseburger + fries. Yeah, that's a lot for one person, but I made it last for five meals. And all of this food cost about $36 with tax. Seriously, an incredible value. 

Parking in that area isn't always easy but don't let that stop you. The food and the service are worth a visit, to eat in or to go. The server who helped me was really nice and she was quite efficient, covering half a dozen tables, the phone, and the cash register. Many more tables were open at 11am on a Tuesday but when they get busy, having that much room is probably very helpful for a lot of hungry people.

Although some of the other items have gotten more hype, the nopalitos were the best of the group. The breakfast dish of eggs, prickly pear cactus, and peppers really hit the spot for me, and contained a more robust and tangy flavor than I anticipated. If this is what a weekday breakfast item tastes like then who knows how good the weekend specials would be.

The pozole was as excellent as described. Huge portions - the larger size is a quart - with huge chunks of tender pork. 

The carne asada was higher quality than I'd expected, in that two small steaks were served whole with 7/8th cuts in them. Definitely tender enough to break apart easily and eat with the veggies provided with a tortilla.

The hamburguesa con queso was ground and hand formed with plenty of cheese. It was a fair to good burger but the value is very high. Given the number of cheeseburgers I've eaten in SF, this truly was an excellent value. I recall a price of $4 but that seems low. Even at $6 it would be a great deal, because an order of fries is included.
author: Mike H.

description:
I'm just going to add to the chorus of voices singing this restaurant's praises. Since we moved to SF from Colorado, we haven't had much luck finding great Mexican food ... until we came upon Gallardos after shopping at nearby Rainbow Co-op.

Highlights of our visit included my posole (huge, wonderful and cheap), my daughter's chicken quesadilla (best ever, she says) and my wife's chile relleno. The service was fantastic and the bill was so low that I checked to make sure they didn't forget to add one of our meals.
author: Todd H.

description: This is not a fancy Mexican restaurant. Instead, this is the kind of place where you go to feel like family. Relaxed atmosphere, great food, and excellent (friendly) service makes this a great place to go if you want tasty food without any pretentious bells and whistles. My girlfriend and I loved the guac in particular!
author: Jack J.

description: Gallardos is hands-down my favorite Mexican place in the city. It's off the beaten path, and the restaurant is generally populated with local Mexicans rather than the Valencia yuppies, which is always a good sign in my opinion. It's humble and unassuming, and the food is absolutely delicious. The salsa they serve before the meal is actually spicy and always tastes freshly-made. I have always ordered the enchiladas, which are some of the best I've had in California, but I have friends who have had the taco and quesadilla plates, and they were equally satisfied. The portions are huge and the entrees are cheap. Also, I recommend the guacamole to start - delicious! The food comes out very quickly, and the waitstaff aren't incredibly attentive but very friendly. This is a great place for people who want delicious, cheap Mexican food and want to support a local, family-owned business.
author: Jordan M.

description:
3.75 stars.  Although I really wanted some breakfast tacos, a quick scan of the Gallardos menu told me that napalitos con huevos (cactus with eggs) would satisfy my appetite.  The cactus here is marinated in vinegar and has a supple texture without being too soft (like one finds at most places that serve cactus).  Tomatoes used here have a slightly sour taste that complements the vinegar from the cactus.  Served with a generous portion of eggs, sauteed onions, a satisfying spicy salsa, and homemade tortillas, this meal makes for a hearty quick breakfast.  Be sure not to miss the freshly squeezed orange juice; you know its fresh because there is a huge pile of oranges behind the glass wall and you can watch the staff make your juice.  Add something quirky to the mostly Mexican jukebox and you are in for a morning treat.  

(I haven't tried either the pozole or birria here, but apparently, those are more than acceptable as well according to other Yelp reviews)
author: Yelper N.

description:
The ladies that work here are so sweet. I didn't know it was cash only and they told
me to just pay next time. Luckily for me the food was inexpensive and the $10 bill I found in my purse covered it. 

They have generous portions and the food is flavorful and fresh. I came for the albondigas soup. It was good but not as authentic as I thought it would be. It came with a lot of fresh onion, cilantro, and a very juicy lime, however the broth was not a clear broth. It was chunky and seemed like the potatoes had been cooked since the beginning which made them fall apart. The meatballs were delicious and hearty and super flavorful. Overall nice details to the food and good ingredients.
author: Shirley S.

description:
This place is really tasty, I had veggie nachos with rice and beans and I loved the rice and beans, and my boyfriend had an egg and shrimp burrito.  I know that sounds strange, but it is really tasty.  He liked it particularly because they took the butts of the shrimp and he hates it when they leave them on.  

My only complaint is that I found a hair fried into my chip and my boyfriend found a hair cooked into his burrito.  But the food was still delicious and so cheap it didn't even seem worth complaining.
author: Jasmine F.

description: Saw this place while walking past, looked inside, it seemed inviting, clean, friendly, attractively decorated, friendly staff. An excellent range of Mexican entrees around $10 on the menu. The food was excellent, the service efficient, I'd certainly go back. Now I've seen the other yelp reviews and agree entirely with almost all.
author: Michael W.

description:
Gallardos offers tasty food and service with a smile.

This was my first meal and it was breakfast: chorizo and cheese omelette with rice, beans and warm tortillas on the side.

I will return and encourage any person who shares my love for Mexican food to add Gallardos to your list!

Well done!
author: Jay D.

description:
Gallardos is OPEN in its new location!!!!!!!
Beautiful restaurant. Delicious authentic food .
author: Connie S.

description: I popped in this morning.  It was my first time coming here.  I really just wanted something in my belly.  I did not expect to get a big, fat, delicious breakfast burrito.  I had hoped for something just decent.  I walked away with a overflowing tortilla of deliciousness.  I am Terd Furgeson and I recommend Gallardos.
author: Terd F.

description: Wow this place is legit! From cabeza hasta lengua! Came in on a busy night and was promptly tended to. Staff is on point and precise. Ordered the carnitas and they were delicious! The vanpiro drink was also very tasty. The only knock I give them is the chips were clearly out of a bag.
author: Beddaden B.

description: Food was ok nothing to write home about the waiter got upset cause we asked for chips and cause he got my order wrong don't think I'll be back and make sure you bring cash the don't accept credit cards.
author: Michael M.

description: I totally like the enchiladas that you can get from here. Beef and extra sour cream and avocado usually make it even better.
author: Krystal S.

description: I love this place. It's super close to my apartment. Prices are great. Everyone is always super nice. And the food is delicious and always fresh. I confess, I need to branch out with the menu. I've only had the tacos, enchiladas, stuffed relleno, rice and beans, etc. After reading other reviews, I realize that I need to try some new things the next time I go. Their freshly made tortillas are absolutely perfect, too. Between them and Poc Chuc, I really have no reason to eat anywhere else (but I will, because I live in food heaven).
author: Rikki J.

description:
I have only been to Gallardo's once but have never forgotten it! 

I ordered the scrambled egg and chorizo torta and was not disappointed.  The portion was huge and the quality excellent! This was a classic torta that I remember my mom making for me in San Diego (where I'm from--a city full of authentic Mexican restaurants). Gallardo's torta could've used a bit less sauce but I'm sure they could've adjusted it for me, had I remembered to ask. In any case, it was delicious. I had it with the nopalitos (tender cactus).  

My husband eats here often because his office is nearby.  I would always hear him comment about the great food, until finally he took me on a weekend.  I am sad Gallardo's is out of the way for me on a regular weekday.  I definately need to go back because I want to try their pozole.........and then their birria........then the burritos, chile relleno, etc., etc.!

If the delicious, authentic, food isn't enough, the decor will transport you to a different place and time.  You will be surrounded by the nostalgia of the Epoca de Oro del Cine Mexicano, which translates to the Golden Age of Mexican Cinema. If you know a bit about this subject then the names of Maria Felix, Jorge Negrete, and Blanca-Estella Pavon will ring a bell.  Make a juke box selection to complete the feel.

Sorry to give 5 stars based on one visit. I will definately try them again and update my review.  For now, they can do no wrong.
author: Angie A.

description:
2 words: Crispy. Tacos. 
3 more words: Best. Mexican. Ever.
2 final words: Huevos Rancheros. 

Love love love this place. It is my absolute go-to in the Mission. 

If you are searching for a great Mexican meal- look no further! Period.
author: Kate D.

description: Get the pozole (rojo) with all the fixins. Every garnish is accounted for. Trust me.
author: Derrick V.

description:
I loved this place. It smelled like my mother-in-law's cooking and tasted almost as good! The service was great and you couldn't beat those prices. I will definitely come back here when I am in the city. 

My only gripe was parking, GOOD LUCK! Oh and make sure to look out for it, we passed it the first time.
author: Threasa B.

description:
I have come here a few times now for breakfast and I am really starting to like it. Very friendly staff. Everyone greats you everyone says goodbye. I mean they apologized to me when they kept speaking spanish to me and realized I am ignorant :) So far I have had their pozole, chorizo and eggs and huevos rancheros. Pretty great stuff. Pozole was really great, a little salty but really tasty. The tortillas that you get are really amazing too. Very fresh and you get a decent amount too. 

Setupwise it's a little tight but it could seat a lot. I mean you walk in and there are like 4 large family tables, and a back room with more. There is a bar that runs around the outside of the first room until the kitchen. A little TV sits above and is sort of the center focus on soccer days, so the food bar is more popular then :) 

I am coming back for the cactus dishes..
author: Greg G.

description: Nasty food, i never review no time, but today I was feeling hungry now I passed that place a few times because it used to be charity's Mexican restaurant, and by that I mean they had great food up until the place burned down a few years back, but anyway I came in and asked for a burrito nothing hard to make as I was in a rush, asked for a carne Asa's burrito make it a super I said, which I added to add avocado and cream, ( butter Mexican) and salsa, well not only was not a super burrito when I opened oh when I was in the car I asked for them to make it to go" and well to my surprise, it was nasty, first it was no carne asada in it (steak) it was ground beef, dried as heck nasty, no avocado, no salsa just the rice and that ugly meet,,, and they charged me 10 bucks for that never again! People please don't make that mistake...
author: Jay M.

description: Disappointed in the food and service.  Mainly food- ordered the chorizo and eggs dish.   I've also tried the camarones al mojo de Ajo.  Also not very good.  Sf has high standards on foods.
author: Salvador S.

description: not open yet, why are there so many reviews of this place already?!
author: Jess C.

description:
I had been meaning to try pozole and based on prior Yelp reviews, this seemed like the place to give it my first taste.  My first spooon was without the fixings (onion, cilantro, hot sauce, red chili flakes, dried oregano - I think, radishes, cabbage, crema, tortillas, limes - yes abundant!!!) and that left me wondering how I would make it through the rest of the bowl.  The soup had a little bit of a canned taste to it surprisingly - I can't place it still exactly but I wouldn't have finished it without dumping in about 1/2 a cup of chopped cilantro, freshly squeezed lime juice, onion and hot sauce. At this point, the mixture became delicious, spicy, tangy and savory.

I had a chance to check out some of the other dishes on nearby tables - some of the egg dishes looked inviting.  The guacamole looked like it had a slightly less than bright color to it and not therefore the absolute freshest, but I didn't try it myself.
author: Elizabeth P.

description: Gallardos doesn't look like much from the outside and is a bit easy to overlook, but inside it's quite spacious, nice and delicious. I've been here twice and got very good service both times.  Unlike so many of the Taquerías around San Francisco, this is a sit down, table-service restaurant.  It's not fancy, but it is clean and comfortable.  The food is excellent, the salsa is on the hot side, carnitas and chicken are very good and the dishes are plentiful.
author: Augie R.

description:
To those of you writing bad reviews about chewy meat on your custom order Tacos... you need to either take into consideration all of these 4/5 star reviews and order some soup or egg dishes, or go to a taco truck if all you want is a soft taco.

Best darn Pozole ever.   I work very near Nopalito, and their $12 pozole tastes like dishwater in comparison to Gallardos'.     The albondigas is outstanding as well. 
The egg dishes I've had have all been pleasing as well.   The odd little portion of chile verde on the side of your eggs is an odd but not undesirable touch.  
They give so many tortillas with your meal it is insane.  Easily 2 pounds of fresh tortillas for 2 people.   Take them home and put some butter and salt, or butter and cinnamon and sugar.   They will give you butter at the restaurant if you want some that way there.  

To the Roach lady.  Just stay home.  You are never 100% free of roaches in city restaurants.  It's a city.  These are old buildings.  And don't ever travel to south east asia if you think you saw a big cockroach at Gallardos you'll be in for a treat. 

To the "taco truck taco" guy.   WTF?  a 1 star review because you didn't like the item you made up that wasn't on their menu?    It's not hard to figure out what's popular at this place.  You can read recommendations here, or you can just look at every other table.  Notice there is soup on EVERY table?  

Hunger is making me grumpy.  i wish there was something even close to Gallardos in the sunset/richmond.
author: howard t.

description: Thee best Mexican food in San Francisco! You guys need to try the machaca plate! It's soo good! The handmade tortillas are a huge plus and excellent service too! ;)
author: Hector E.

description: Fix your Restaurant hours please!  If you say you open at 7am and i come at 8am don't tell me to come back 9am.. What a joke!!!
author: Akiliano T.

description: Excellent authentic mexican.food. Great for breakfast. Very good portions, prices are reasonable and service is good. You may need to wait for a table depending on.the time you go, but well worth the wait. They also make fresh handmade tortillas. Go check them out.
author: Ronette B.

description:
Update: 10/16/2016
We stopped in last night, a rainy night, only six other people at 3 other tables.
