Ordered the Combo plate of enchilada/chile relleno. I'm sorry Yelpers, but I gotta be honest: the enchilada was the usual yummy but the chile relleno was from a few days ago! the egg batter started chewy and had this funky taste and toward the end of the chile, the egg batter was so chewy I could not cut it with my fork. Our waters went dry twice and each time i had to flag down the busy person( talking with the other cooks) that our waters were empty. Truth be told!
author: Bert K.

description: Absolutely wonderful breakfast. Love this restaurant. Clean. great staff. Wish it were in Wichita.
author: Keith F.

description:
The place moved.  I am sad.  It was right next to my work and was really a great lunch place.  I am sure the food is just as good in the new location.  I just need to get over to it.

The tacos are huge.  A single taco lunch can fill most people and makes lunch cheap.  Burritos are good and big.  The soups. I love the soups.  Pozole  is good.  Chicken is super chunky and good.  Beef is still on the bone and so flavorful.  Side condiments are available to add as you see fit.

Thursday was my favorite special.  Chicken Thursday.  Marinated really well.  Tender.  Juicy.  Good sides.  One of my favorite lunches in the area.

I will miss it and will need to plan longer lunches to go there.  It shall occur
author: Clifford S.

description: Great, standard Mexican food.  Everything they make is done well. I love their caldos (soups) and egg dishes.  My son loves the machaca.  Great handmade tortillas.  Any Mexican restaurant that still makes handmade corn tortillas automatically gets a strong rating.  Very clean.  Quick service.  Generous servings.  Outdoor seating available.  Inconsistency about accepting credit cards (bring cash just in case), and chips are not tasty and not free for breakfast.  Solid, friendly, long-time, Mission district business that's worth supporting.
author: Magdalena B.

description:
Great Non-Hyped Mexican. They were great when on Folsom and have continued with the new location



NOTE re Jared C. review 8/13/14 whining about no cash policy: Get over it. It is an owners prerogative. Refreshing. Cash works fine. Remember?
author: El R.

description: This is me and my wife's go to spot for breakfast. One of the best original down home Mexican spots in the city not taken over by hipsters.
author: Robert S.

description:
Really excellent!  I was looking for a taqueria on a hung over Sunday morning (ok... it was more like Sunday afternoon) I stumbled upon this place.   Being only a few blocks away from my place, my girlfriend and I decided to check it out.  I was at first surprised that this wasnt a take out Mexican place like I've been accustomed to in the Mission.  This is a sit down restaurant that families tend to come to have lunch.  We decided to try it out anyway and were blown away.  The quality of the food, portion size, and price were just really outstanding.   We've been back since and everything I've tried has been fantastic.  The carnitas are really fantastic, as is the chile verde plate.  For around $9 you get a huge plate of meat, rice, veggies, and possibly the best refried beans I've ever had.  On top of all that you get a grilled pepper to top off the dish.    

If you're looking for a change from the normal taqueria or just a sit down Mexican place for lunch, you really have to try this place.  As long as I live in SF I will be back to this place often and next time I'm hung over, the menudo from this place is for sure going to be my cure.
author: Yuri Y.

description:
My go to in the immediate hood bfast stop.  Totally a Latino family joint.  Groups of guys who look like father & sons or co-workers, large families, etc.  HUGE portions.  Mexican Hot Chocolate YEAH.  Great fresh OJ.  

And amazing amazing movie posters of stars from the 40's.
author: nomi c.

description: So delicious! Took a trip to San Fran came here for breakfast Saturday morning. I got their camarones a la diabla which were sooooo delicious! I would definitely recommend this place I was skeptical walking down from our apartment through the neighborhood but don't let that stop you, this place is really nice. Definitely 5 stars! Oh btw they ONLY accept cash!
author: Jen A.

description:
Good customer service i asked for something not on the menu and they did a pretty good job making it. They were next to my work, unfortunately they moved. I hope to go again to there new location.

Support small business, dont kill'em.
author: Bash C.

description: my local neighborhood spot. authentic and awesome mexican food. burritos are awesome. service is great... could work on their wait line process.
author: john l.

description:
Good, cheap food.

Bad experience today though.  Chicken fajitas were dry and 4 other tables came in sat and were served before us.

Go when it's not busy, get an egg dish and you'll be happy.  A plate big enough for 2 for $7.
author: Nate P.

description:
This place is fantastic. It really is cheap and they prepare very tasty food that sure seems authentic to me. When I was in there today, for the first time, my friend and I were the only gringas in the place, the only people not speaking Spanish so I guess some Latinos in the area think it is tasty and, maybe, authentic-tasting Mexican food.  That seems to speak well of the place -- at least to me. 

I 'just' got huevos rancheros.  IMHO, the simple dish of huevos rancheros reveals how well the chef understands eggs, frijoles, rice and tortillas. I often order this item as my first time in a Mexican restaurant. Testing such a simple 'classic' is a good test, at least I think so.

We split a side order of chorizo with scrambled eggs cause they don't sell just the chorizo/sausage but the waitress had the kitchen hold back the additional rice & beans and talked us out of ordering two orders of chorizo -- which we really wanted to do, imagining we would get sausage links but, nope, they only sell diced chorizos scrambled perfectly and sublimely. And the waitress insisted we not order two 'sides' of chorizo, she said with our two orders of huevos rancheros, it would just be way too much food.  I balked, tried to insist we were up for lots of chorizo and she insisted we just get the one order and see what it looked like. She was right. I had so much food that I was unable to eat all of it.

With two entrees, coffee and that side order of chorizo scrambled with eggs, the bill came to $22.75. The huevos rancheros -- sublimely perfect -- are $6.75. 

My idea of good huevos rancheros:  runny, creamy, frijoles -- not beans but mushed up twice cooked gooey frijoles, a good tortilla under the two sunny-side-up eggs. Then mix the runny egg yolks with the perfect frijoles, scoop & dip with the stack of very good side tortillas.  It's an awesome comfort food, IMHO. Soothing, simple and awesomely delicious. We also mushed in the chorizo & scrambled eggs, but left about half the chorizo/egg on the plate. We could not eat everything we had.  

I'll be back, even tho I don't have a car and it is a longish walk from 16th St BART
author: Shaniqua A.

description:
Weekend brunch = menudo time!  My first menudo and as expected, it was delicious!  It comes with so many dressings too - onions, cilantro, radishes, tortillas, cabbage, Mexican oregano, and chili flakes.  One note is that I'm a tripe lover - in pho, Chinese dishes, Incanto-style all.  So not for novices.  

My compadres ordered pozole, enchildas de mar, and combo enchiladas - all loved and all was gone.  The house chips & salsa are clearly homemade and fantastic too.  

Gallardos is a authentic, family-style place - at the time we went, we were the only 4 non-Mexicans in the place.  Friendly and timely service, and easy street parking, especially during Sunday lunchtime.   

I'll definitely be coming back for more menudo, posole, and other dishes!  

One drawback is that I'm used to Vietnamese pho having everything together - not just tripe in one dish but also the meat and noodles.  I'm going to make my own Mexican pho next time!
author: FoodieGal I.

description: Favorite Mexican breakfast in the city! Do come early though, this place gets busy. I love anything they make with chorizo. The goat stew is also very, very good. I was eyeing someone else's and decided to get my own one morning. The man sitting next to me was kind enough to explain what the different bowls of condiments were and I had amazing feast. Portions there are huge. One reviewer mentioned their salsa - and yes, it is the best. I ate almost an entire jar of it one morning... Love to see cool, local, small businesses thrive!
author: S.T. C.

description: For a taste treat which will have you going back again and again, try this Mexican restaurant in the Mission.  I have been looking for a good Mexican restaurant for a long time and I have now found it.  I ordered Chilaquiles which were absolutely fantastic - the flavor stuck with me all day long.  The setting is nice and the service was excellent - our waitress was prompt, pleasant and willing to explain several things to us about the menu as well as the history of the restaurant itself.  There is outside seating  and I understand it is dog friendly.  Open for breakfast and lunch; we were there around 10:30 and had our choice of tables, but I understand it gets quite crowded at lunch time.  Give it a try, I don't think you will be disappointed.
author: Jack S.

description: My bf and I came here at 8am a few months ago, hungover and exhausted from the previous night's partying.  We stumbled across this little hidden gem that served their entire menu all day long.  How fortuitous, as I was in no mood for a traditional breakfast with french toast or eggs.  I wanted me some pozole and boy, was I rewarded with my decision.  Best pozole ever, with lots of lime and diced onions added on top.  My boyfriend got the chorizo scramble w/ soft tortillas and french toast.  The serving sizes are enormous, service is friendly and wonderful, and our total bill came out to only $25 including two cups of coffee, tax and tip.  We were happy campers for the rest of the day and our hangovers were cured!
author: Jen Y.

description: AMAZING!!! I love chilaquiles and these were some of the best I've ever had. Even better than my own mom's. From the moment you walk in this place smells incredible. I can't wait to go back and try the rest f the menu.
author: Claudia M.

description: Been in SF for four years and haven't found some good birria, until now. The broth is tasty, rich in flavor and the meat is not dry or flavorless. Although, I wish it was hotter in temperature.
author: Kristine R.

description: favorite hangover spot.  Bowl of Pozole and 2 Micheladas will fix you right up!  so gooooooooooooood
author: Mimi X.

description:
In my opinion, while San Francisco has a surfeit of good taquerias, it has very few good sit-down Mexican places.  Several of my favorites have closed--I still mourn Casa Agilas way out in the Sunset.  So for a couple of years I've been looking for a new place and this may be it.  It's awfully inconspicuous--hard to spot even, as you drive down Folsom.  And when you approach the door, the impression is of a small dumpy place.  But the inside will amaze you--it's quite large and pleasant.

The usual chips and salsa offered to start are good--the salsa had some serious heat.  I had a combo plate with a chile relleno and a pork enchillada.  The menu seems to indicate if you order 2 pork enchilladas by themselves, they will come with green sauce, but mine (with the chile relleno) had a red sauce, a slight disappointment.  I'm sure if I had though to request green they woud have happily provided it.  Anyway,  the enchilada was very tasty,  The chile was also but regretably they covered it up with a pile of chopped iceberg lettuce I had to push aside.  I really wish Mexican places would abandon this habit of putting piles of undressed lettuce and maybe a tomato slice on the plate--who ever eats it?

I asked for iced tea but what came was raspberry flavored tea--not what I expected but very tasty (I drank 2 glasses).  Finally, I was seriously thinking about some desert and hoping they had flan, but my very sweet waitress didn't ask about desert--she just brought my check and I abandoned the idea.

All in all, very satisfying.  A few quirks to get used to, but satisfying and a good place to know about.  On this Saturday evening they were practically empty, though--just one other occupied table while I was there--so I hope more people try it and keep them in business.
author: B. T.

description: I Love this place and try to come here as often as I can.  I've been eating here for about 15 years now.  The food is authentic and reasonably priced.   I usually order the pozole which is the best I've had in SF. Also they have the most amazing homemade tortillas!
author: Mikky T.

description:
Man Pozole on a weekday love it ....SO now I can have Mon hangover or a midweek hang over and I can still get Pozole WOW....

Should I start drinking more hmmm
author: Kim R.

description: The pozole is very tasty.  The large bowl was definitely plenty for me and the BF. The tacos we got (chicken and carne asada) were okay, but it was second fiddle to the star... a rich, hearty pork soup with abundant fixin's.  Will be back when the weather gets colder and I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Mercutio k.

description:
Man, this place is a GEM. 

On a Sunday at 11:30am, when most San Franciscians are waiting in long lines for brunch in the Mission and Hayes Valley, come to Gallardos instead.

Table for 8? Not a problem, they have large circular tables already set for large parties.

Authentic (meaning I'm usually the only white girl in there), cheap ($6-10) Mexican breakfasts, with fast and friendly service. 

Atmosphere is a plus: jukebox was playin' some mariachi jams and the pictures of old school Mexican movie stars make for a fun vibe.
author: Hannah L.

description: I enjoyed my hearty breakfast at Gallardos.  It's not the best mexican food I've ever had, but the stuff is good.  We had carnitas (good) and albondigas (seriously disappointing).  The tortillas, as noted elsewhere, are incredibly fresh and good.  The salsa could be hotter.  Guacamole is gooood.  The beans and rice were below average.  My michelada was f#ckin amazing though. Perfectly spicy and delicious. Do order one (or two or three. Mine was Modelo).  Best of all though was probably the feel of the place. Spanish being spoken and music blaring from the jukebox at 10 AM...I can't complain about that.
author: Delan B.

description:
Came here for posole after searching for a good, authentic spot on yelp. Yep... drove to the mission on my lunch break, solo, when it was raining, for a nice big bowl of Mexican soup- I'm a winner.

Sat at the bar, the waiter was super friendly. I ordered a small bowl of posole AND a taco because it looked good and the waiter assured me the posole would probably be enough.

Came out piping hot with all the fixin's, tortillas, tostadas, lime, radishes, onion etc. Extremely delicious and hit the spot on this particular rainy SF day. I went back to work a happy camper and will definitely be back to try their other famed soups and yummy looking items.
author: Sarah A.

description:
perfect lazy sunday = mexican hot chocolate, huge fluffy pancakes, and huevos con chorizo, all topped off with cheap prices and friendly and quick service (and i mean ridiculously quick)

side note: as my friend and i were waiting for our food and spying on other peoples' food, we noticed that literally every single table had at least one bowl of pozole. "maybe we should have ordered that...?" guess i'll be seeing you again real soon, gallardos!
author: Stephanie C.

description: The food is delicious. I searched for a restaurant that had Pozole and Gallardos popped up. I ordered papas con huevos and  a bowl of Pozole. The portion size was perfect and the food was amazing. It is definitely authentic Mexican food. I definitely know where I am going for Mexican food in the city.
author: Yvette S.

description: Pozole everyday = awesome.  Very hearty meals with lots of flavor and a nice staff.  Their chips aren't the greatest and the tacos are a little on the heavy side to where you can't eat them without a fork.  Large fresh tortillas and good daily specials also make this place great.
author: German L.

description: After a day of hiking in Muir Woods the family crossed the Golden Gate and decided on Mexican food. I yelped and saw they had amazing pozole. We navigated our way and never would have noticed this place just driving by. We had a party of 10 and the food was fast, great and being Mexican myself I am always a bit judgey when it comes to real Mexican food, I must say the pozole was on hit. We will definitely be back!
author: Judy P.

description: OMG!  Best Breakfast Barritos in town... I move here many years ago from the south (Texas & Alabama) and I have never found a place that can make good breakfast barritos here until now....  SWEET!
author: Kevin R.

description:
This is my new go to place for Mexican brunch.  

I'm a big weekend Mexican brunch fan, especially where they serve menudo.  They have generous nice cuts of tripe in a tasty broth, with all the traditional toppings.  The fresh, warm tortillas, chips, and salsa on the side are a great accompaniment.  The prices are reasonable.  About $8 for a large serving for a sit down place like this is OK in my book (I stopped going to Los Jarritos when they raised their prices to $10 a bowl.  $10 for a bowl of menudo just seems wrong.  I brought a large group of my family there for dinner once as well and it wasn't that great, but back to Gallardos...).

If you aren't into menudo, they also have plenty of other brunch options, pozole, huevos rancheros, omelets, shrimp cocktails, other egg dishes, as well as their regular menu.  Most of the people I go with usually opt for one of these options and seem pretty happy about it.

The wait staff has always been very friendly.  Always smiling and quick to refill your coffee (which is not bad at all) and water.

All the times I've been here were with groups of 7+ plus people, which they are able to accommodate.
author: eugene c.

description: Gallardo's is like eating at your best friend's grandma's house, bad coffee and all. 7am till dinner, umm fantastic...! Pozole is mi favorito -- day or night, pero todo el mundo de la menu es fantastica tambien. Ustedes quiero!
author: eVa J.

description: My first time and last.  The food was lukewarm. The carnitas looked and tasted like shoe leather. There were two of us and neither one could eat the food. We both have eaten Mexican food throughout the Mission and never had an experience like this. Worse food ever served to me. The service was fine.
author: Bert J.

description: ALBODINGAS,PACIFICO and TORTILLAS por favor!!!
author: Curt M.

description: For someone who is very particular about Mexican food, Gallardo's is one my favorite local spots! Friendly service, excellent food and fun decor! Highly Recommend the chilaquiles, pozole & michelada! Buen Provecho!
author: Anna D.

description: If they bought better meat it would be 4 stars. Great ambiance, service, and presentation. Red chile sauce was excellent. But my beef enchilada was full of inedible gristle - some of the worst meat I've ever been served in a restaurant. Que lastima!
author: Stuart M.

description: probably my new favorite place to get mexican food! i love how you can mix and match items to get your perfect plate. everything here is fresh and the portions are more than substantial. i had the combo plate that came with an enchilada, a taco, and rice and beans. so good! as i was looking around, everything else i saw looked amazing too. i can't wait to come back again and again to try everything else!
author: Sabrina L.

description: This place was EXCELLENT! Really delicious and inexpensive with large portions. I went with coworkers for lunch and although the server was overwhelmed (they were slammed which is also a good sign) she was cheerful and very nice. I got the chopped steak with tomato sauce and I can't wait for the leftovers. The place was also very clean and charmingly decorated. I'll go back all the time!
author: E H.

description: From the street, you would never know what kind of gem this place really is....through the doors though....Excellent authentic food, the atmosphere is like being in an open air cafe with a very friendly wait staff and the Chef comes out along with the manager asking how the food was and  inquiring about the food and was it prepared to your liking. I will recommend this place to everyone I come in contact with....the restrooms were clean and tidy as well.
author: David S.

description:
Yes, I AM A FAN! 

I've been going to this restaurant since I was a child, my dad likes to go here to get the Birria on the weekends for la familia. 

This is a great spot to go after a long night of patying, El Menudo, La Birria , and Los Chilaquiles are the BEST!  

I also enjoy the fresh orange and carrot juice :) Yummy stuff.
author: Claudia G.

description:
Love Gallardo's I eat here every Sunday and I am never disappointed!
It is the best authentic food and the staff is nice and friendly.  It does get crowded but the wait is no more then 10 minutes.  So this is my spot!!

Everyone comes down and makes us take them there and they look forward to the dining.  I have a big fat Mexican family and they always are able to accommodate our large group.  They sometimes have a cute little boy helping to clean he thinks he's a real worker and likely will be one day!!

I love places where they remember your order even when you forget to mention no crema.
author: Tracy B.

description: Fantastic food, friendly service, and good prices.  Just about my favorite Mexican spot in San Francisco.
author: Robert B.

description: Break the taco shop routine! We dont have enough Mexican food restaurants in SF and this place really hits the spot for a girl from the southwest. Mexican breakfast with handmade tortillas and coffee served up with a side of spicy salsa. mm mm good. The decor alone gets 5 starts, all walls are filled with old-school black and white film noir movie star posters (think Clark Gable Gone with the wind-ish). Try to cactus omelets and the chilaquiles and your heart will smile :-)
author: Jordan V.

description: As a Mexican living in San Francisco I am picky with Mexican food. This place is so delicious. Everything is really fresh, the people are so incredibly nice and the service is so kind. This place is exactly like their pozole: hearty, authentic, generous.
author: D Z.

description: The excellent birria de borrego on weekends served with fresh, homemade tortillas will bring me back again and again!
author: Nick L.

description:
went because yelp reviews were so high. My friend had errands at Costco and it's only 2 blocks away so we met there. 

PROS:
-great chips
-great guacamole

CONS:
-bad service (place was empty...we were 1 of 3 tables with patrons)
-carne asada tacos were gross
-food overall was mediocre
-most of the patrons had ordered hamburgers (ok I guess that is what is best there so note to self go to Mexican place to get a burger next time)
-special was some kind of veggie enchilada with fried chicken (note to self, go to Mexican restaurant for fried chicken or hamburgers)

Ok, back to PANCHO VILLA or EL TORO....so hard to beat!
author: Jane C.

description:
I maintain that I can not find a good, solid Mexican restaurant in LA. Sure, there are plenty of good taco trucks, but for other traditional fare? I am often disappointed by lackluster meals which utilize cheese as its main component. While I still haven't discovered the best home style Mexican restaurant in my hood, at least I can say that I've found one in SF. 

Gallardos comes amazingly correct with its food, especially the soups, and specifically the posole. Right after my best friend's mom's home cooked version, this is the best. The pork is tender and immense in flavor, elevating the soup to the next level. Even as I got full, I just could not stop consuming the posole. It is borderline addictive.

Served with both tostadas and warm tortillas, tons of seasoning/onions/cilantro for you to add as you please, it's really one of my favorite meals at this point.

Next time I'm in the area, I'd like to try the menudo, which again is difficult to find a good version of at restaurants. But the posole is just that good, that I continue to order it each time I make my way over there. Some habits are hard to break, I guess.

While some people leave their hearts in San Francisco, I've definitely left mine in an empty soup bowl at Gallardos.
author: Karen T.

description: Very clean, well lit place with beautiful framed movie stills from 1940s-50s Mexican cinema (the "golden age of Mexican cinema"). Food is honest no-frills Mexican at cheap prices. Wait staff is fast, friendly and efficient.
author: John G.

description:
Saucy. Steamy. Gargantuan.

Nopalito con juevos burrito in my face.  My arm was getting a work out just carrying that burrito back to work!

Piping hot, flavorful cactus.... overflowing scrambled eggs....juicy and robust rice, potatoes, and beans.....oozy goozy melted cheese for days....OH BEHAVE!

Could only manage to down scarf half of my bor-ee-to: more for later!  And all for $5.75!  Would give this place 5 stars if the chips weren't terrible - super dry, but still greasy?, super thick but not crunchy (kind of stale).  

Will definitely be back for the torta - can't resist'em - when I'm feeling shameless.  

Also serve a wide variety of combo meals and a la carte tacos.

$From 5.50 for a regular burrito to $12 for entrees, your broke a** can eat here too! ^_^
author: Jane L.

description:
LOVE. THIS. PLACE. We've ordered a lot of different things from the menu: chicken flautas (beautiful!); menudo (amazing!); albondigas (like a huge hug to your stomach); sopes (so damn good), chilaquiles (perfection!), etc.

I wish it stayed open later at night but that's the only real issue I have w/ this place.
author: Minh-Ha P.

description: A co-worker recommend this place and after reading positive reviews I decided to have lunch today. I was contemplating in having  flautas or enchiladas del mar. I opted for the latter. Yes, they serve huge portions but I was  not totally thrilled with the food. The enchiladas had a big of un-melted american cheese on top of it. The shrimps were overcooked and the tomatoes sauce was a tad sweet. The plate was hot but the food was lukewarm.  Fast service which makes me believe that many of the items are precooked. Friendly service. Expansive place but with poor lighting. I will go back and order the flautas.
author: Hum V.

description:
Is this this same place?!
Craving tacos for breakfast, I yelped up Gallardos which was nearby.  The place was full and looked promising.  The menu was typical Mexican fare, including breakfast.  I ordered the taco combination plate.  On the menu it's crispy tacos but I requested plain ol' street tacos.  Meat, cilantro, onions, sauce on a tortilla.  One carne asada and one pork.  
Man, what a disappointment!  The tacos came "super" which means lettuce, cheese, guacamole and sauce.  The carne asada wasn't grilled like these pictures.  It was like stewed or something and very tough.  The pork was worse.  It was tougher and seemed like it was cooked the day before.  Long story short, I didn't even finish the plate.  The rice and beans were decent but I didn't come for rice and beans.  The fresh squeezed orange juice was served at room temperature with no ice.  The waitress was nice but the food was awful.  For you "don't knows" there's waaaay better places in the area.  Please educate yourselves.
Street parking can be tough.
author: Pablo R.

description: Well I cook a lot so I can be a food snob. This place is close to my office so I'm starving today so a breakfast burrito should be cool. The place is pretty clean and they have the cutest lil lady behind the counter which is always a plus. When I make my own breakfast burrito I don't add rice  & beans and I like my bacon a little before well done. I have fancy iron pots to help get a few slices of pig  just right. So to compare my home made burrito with theirs is probably not adequate. However I'm no longer hungry so mission accomplished. I will remember to ask that they hold the beans and cook my bacon a little harder. It was $5 bucks .75  and enough for two!! I think it would have been better if I had given more directions or special request.
author: Andre F.

description: GF recommended this place and we tried it out for breakfast.  The orange juice is a fan fav as it is freshly made.  I ordered the Machaca con huevo.  The beans were tasty, the tortillas fresh, and the rest was very tasty and served with healthy portions and the price was great.  I'll be coming back and trying other breakfast dishes.
author: ed c.

description: It felt like being in my grandmas kitchen. I ordered 2 carne asada soft tacos with rice and beans. Yum they got their carne asada down right. I was one my hour lunch so speed mattered. I was in and out in 30mins. The staff is very friendly.  They have odd hours though. I have been back but they were closed those 2 times. :(
author: V M.

description:
Hail holy hell!  Why have I not discovered this place before?!?!

This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in all of San Francisco.

Hands down!
author: Larry A.

description: Fantastic for morning breakfast with a large group - wonderful friendly service and generous portions. We have made it our regular monthly weekday breakfast place for our work group to rejuvenate and reconnect. Appreciated the bonus plantains as well!
author: Neda R.

description: I have been going to Gallardo's for years and I wouldn't go anywhere else. I love their posole the best. My husband and son love their burrito mojado's. All the food is great. I have had chilaquiles, american breakfast (french toast, eggs & bacon), burittos, enchiladas, fajitas, etc. I just can't say enough good things. Juan Manuel and his wife are wonderful people as well as all the staff there. It is bright and inviting and you feel like you are part of their family. I recommend you go and visit and check it out for yourself. You will not be disappointed.
author: Vickie M.

description:
This is good, real deal mexican food. LA quality, right in the bay. Who would have figured?

The soups are frickin' amazing. Sadly, I've not been able to get a bowl of birria, but the Menudo, Pozole, Caldo de Camaron, and Albondigas has been AWESOME.

The tortillas are hand made, and absolutely the best I've had outside of southern california.

Like I said, this is high quality, LA style Mexican food. Most SF hipsters would be strongly advised to go to more insipid places like El Toro (2.0 BLEH!).

My only complaint, and the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5, is that the carnitas were a bit on the dry side. Flavorful, but dry.
author: Dave M.

description: I love love this place so much. My favorite things are the the pozole and chicken enchiladas verdes. SO GOOD and very reasonably priced. I wouldn't come here to get tacos or burritos - go to a taqueria for that. The people are friendly and efficient. Yes, it's cash only but who cares. In fact, I'm glad it's cash only so whiny "i refuse to carry cash" people steer clear. Also, very good micheladas.
author: kathleen m.

description:
My family has known the owners for years, even before the place opened.  Great food and authentic flavors "a estilo jalisco".

When it comes to Menudo, I am very selective...since my mom makes the best, I only eat it where my mom eats it.  This is some great menudo, especially with the home made corn tortillas.

Comfort Mexican food!
author: A P.

description: Man their POZOLE is bomb!!! Really authentic!! I also love their freshly squeezed OJ!!! Too bad the restaurant close early say around 4-5pm daily which makes me sad....
author: Cee M.

description:
Look, I'm not even done with my meal yet and I'm compelled to write this review. I'm at my desk, eating my albondigas soup and I'm this close to licking my bowl. So fucking good. 

This place is a little gem, hidden away in the Mission, and you should really go there. Like right now.
author: Andi R.

description:
Super authentico mexican food with a relaxed, family run atmosphere. Try not to fill up on the chips and spicy salsa beforehand...mucho addictive. 

I ordered a chicken taco salad with mounds of marinated, shredded chicken, lettuce, avocado and tomatoes in deep fried crispy shell the size of a large helmet. Tasty. The only thing missing was sour cream, which I ordered on the side to make it a great tasting, 1000+ calorie 'salad' I was looking for. Next time I think I'll skip the beans, which didn't jive with the rest of the flavors, but otherwise it was muy yum. 

My boy who frequents this spot about 3x a week had the sopas, which are like thick tostadas made with masa. delicious and filling. He recommended the posole (mexican version of pho) on a cooler day, since it is "to die for" and the small bowl could feed a family of four.
author: Kelly R.

description: My family and I went to Gallardo's Monday morning for a birthday breakfast for Mom. I'm a native in the area and had no idea the place even existed. As we entered the first thing I liked were the old style high ceilings that remind me of old SF Victorians. The second thing were the many posters of legendary Mexican movie stars that cover the whole place. The third thing was the great jukebox with good sound and a nice selection of Latino music (viva Chente!). The rest was best, great food and very warm fuzzy service. Viva Mexico, viva Gallardos!
author: Ron O.

description:
These guys must have some kind of futuristic Star Trek Matter Discombobulator geegaw because I see no other reason for an order of enchiladas in red sauce, PLEASE NO ONIONS to show up as an order of enchiladas in green sauce, chock full of onions, with an extra bonus side of cook's hair.

I am adding a star because the manager/cook was incredibly apologetic and offered to remake everything. When my dining companion, Senorita La Puta and I refused, he graciously comped both of our meals, apologizing all the way.

I may return because I am addicted to their fried plantains, or I may not because I'm not especially addicted to flossing while I eat.
author: Frankie D.

description:
If you want good authentic mexican food at an incredibly good price - GO HERE!!

My boyfriend and I have been here a dozen times, and we have never been disappointed. From the caldos (soups) to the burritos to the breakfast plates... basically everything on the menu is fantastic. The freshly squeezed orange juice is a must (ask for a cup of ice on the side if you like your juices cold) The fresh home-made tortillas are amazing. The service is always promp, friendly, and accommodating.  

One warning, come with a big appetite because the meals here are not for weight-watchers. Besides the huge portions, the meals are slightly calorie-dense. However, they are willing to split the plate for you upon request. Come for breakfast or brunch and you will have the rest of the day to burn-off the tortillas

We would drive across town anytime, any day for this amazing mexican food!
author: Daven D.

description:
Great Restaurant!!

Great food!! Tastes like home cookin!! All the mexican dishes we ordered were good, we all tasted each other's food and it was YUM!!
Even random, one of the little ones ordered French Toast..and it was super good-cinnamon perfect texture..it was shocking! We really expected that to taste okay since it's not an "American" restaurant!!

Service was super friendly, quick and they even upgraded a side order to a family size so we could all eat some ON THE HOUSE!!!

So affordable, not over-priced at all!! Parking on a Sunday was easy, too!! Can't wait to go back!!!!
author: M R.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco, Mexican or otherwise. I have had dozens of things on the menu and everything is as good as the last. I have been coming here for almost 20 years now, and it's still amazing.  If you haven't been here - go.  If you don't like it, I'll let you punch me in the face...
author: Jon B.

description:
Been here once, but will definitely be back. Its family-friendly Mexican food and its good! I had a breakfast dish of a vegetable scramble. My date had a combination platter of Chile Relleno and an enchilada. Both dishes were very good. I asked for some extra heat and the owner brought out some homemade hot sauce and grilled jalapeno peppers. Very tasty and spicy! I was impressed with the quality of the food and the level of service we received. They treat people well here. The dishes were also affordable and at a great value for the quality of food and service we received.

I would give it five stars, but I thought the bathroom was dirty and I was disappointed to see that this place does not accept credit cards on the weekend. So be forewarned, please bring cash if you come on a Saturday or Sunday. Otherwise, it is excellent. And we will be back!
author: Matt D.

description:
The best authentic Mexican food EVER!
Everything is delicious, the guacamole is the best!
The price is good. Their menu is filled with different items, chilaquiles, posole, enchiladas, gorditas, etc. Home made tortillas! Meals cooked fresh! I can eat there every day! :)
author: Maribel Q.

description: Delicious Mexican food at a reasonable price. Nice ambiance. I wasn't sure why I should go to a sit down restaurant when there are taquerias nearby, but this place is definitely worth going to. Staff is friendly as well. We will be returning.
author: John-Mark I.

description: I love this place for the pozole, my favorite in the city.  You get a nice size serving of this pork stew and throw on oregano, red pepper, cracked tortilla, radishes, cilantro, and drizzle it with lime.  (I skip the sour cream).  What makes this pozole special is the rich pork flavor in the broth.  And the quanitity is great.  A delicious meal in a bowl.
author: John T.

description: Gallardo's is an awesome authentic Mexican restaurant. Everything on their menu is excellent. The menudo is the only exception. I found the menudo to be overcooked. The pozole is awesome as well as the Albodingas. Now I know most people have noticed at MOST MEXICAN RESTAURANTS the beans are not tasty at all. Well, at GALLARDOS the beans are sabroso, delcioso. If you are hungry then order the Guadalajara Special Dinner.
author: Christopher G.

description: We are SO happy to see this place reopened.  The new location looks great!  The food and the menu are the same (as good as ever)!  It looks like they extended their hours into the evening (great).  Only complaint...MAKE MORE BIRRIA...they are selling out too early.
author: Aaron C.

description: By far one of the most authentic mexican restaurants in SF. I love their Pozole and Menudo. The machaca con huevo is very good(shredded beef and scramble eggs). This place is run by a family from Jalisco, Mx. Very friendly folks and they go out of their way to make you feel at home. If they are busy do not expect the same treatment. $
author: Nelson M.

description:
For those of us who work north of the Mission but CRAVE Mexican food on our lunch hour (and don't want to walk too far south), this is a decent place for a quick sit-down, restaurant-style lunch. It was a little dark in the dining room area, but the funky pictures on the wall made it interesting enough. On our way out, there were two younger girls peeling avocados and throwing the pits into a large white bucket. You know what that means: fresh guacamole and family-run.

During the World Cup, they had soccer playing on a decent-sized TV in the bar area. Tables were set up where you could watch it from your seat. Worth a try if you're in the neighborhood. They pile on a bunch of sour cream, guacamole and other salsas atop your enchiladas or tamales or burritos, whether you want it or not. HUGE PORTIONS, so beware.
author: Dave K.

description: Second yelp review ever! BEST MEXICAN FOOD PLACE in SF. Try their milanesa torta, pozole or birria.I do agree with others that say it gets busy during peak hours and weekends, just something to note.
author: Grecia L.

description:
I didn't have very high hopes for this place, but I was pleasantly surprised.  It wasn't crowded, and I appreciate that.  The service was friendly, and the food was delicious.  

As a previous Yelper noted, he thought the chips were fried in lard...I'm not sure but they were pretty tasty, and the table salsa wasn't the usual bland fare.  

My flautas were done to perfection:  not too crispy, not too soft, and topped with a generous helping of cream and guacamole.  I'd certainly return for more!
author: Ken B.

description:
This is down home Mexican food where the amazing sensations of rice, salsa, beans, homemade tortillas live harmoniously on one plate. As you move from the enchilada to the taco, through the beans and into the rice, you find yourself eating faster with excitement. Hoping that the next bite is a rich and wonderful as the last.
High recommend this place when you are fed up with the usual eat-and-run taquerias. Sit down, order something different and enjoy the sweet melodies of Los Panchos playing on the jukebox.
author: Travis W.

description: Great authentic food. Just shy of five stars for me but my favorite sit down place in the mission.
author: Ian W.

description:
4 stars excusively for the birria every weekend.  The portions are enormous, the meat is fabulous, and the servers are very nice and prompt.  

-1 star for something that might not even be their fault: at least twice while I was there, they seemed to be having electrical problems which made it somewhat difficult to see.
author: Casey S.

description:
ok this place serves great, authentic, tasty mexican food. I am a picky eater and I don't like going to taquerias all the time.
this place is great for families and friends. The staff are friendly and the menu is extensive. Good prices for big portions.
They have fresh orange and carrot juices. 
They offer free chips and salsa when you sit down at the table.
The only downside is they don't accept credit cards. But hey, if you go with friends, you can always go dutch.
author: Mauling W.

description:
Friendly staff, authentic and tasty food, inexpensive

I tried Birria (on their weekend brunch menu) for the first time here and really liked it.  The meat tasted a little "game-y" at first, but thats something I appreciate once in a while after living in Alaska and eating caribou, etc...  

My date voted five stars too... she had the chicken enchiladas plate.
author: John L.

description:
We love this place and have been coming for at least 5 years.

Mostly we come on weekends and can get busy but no line and service is prompt and friendly.  Food is homemade Mexican traditional Mexican style with large + portions and no one can finish the soups.  My favorite is carnitas plater; wife's albondigas.  Usual combinations are very good so you won't go wrong with any (we've not done hamburgers but do look good).
author: Richard K.

description: The cuisine here is AMAZINGLY flavorful, and authentically so! The red chile enchilada sauce is the perfect degree of spicy and you can TASTE the complexity of the red chile in it, which is rare. The establishment is CLEAN with full view of their immaculate and fully-functional kitchen. Fresh oranges are stacked nicely for fresh juice along the kitchen counter's glass viewing area. The service was friendly and good. A gem of San Francisco for certain. I've been to Mexican restaurants in Arizona, New Mexico, Los Angeles, Texas, Colorado, Washington DC, but some of the best are in Stockton, CA and Gallardos is right up there with them! I had brunch: Tocino and Huevos over easy... for you GRINGOS y gringitas, that's good ole fashioned bacon and eggs. The bacon was PERFECTLY crispy like I prefer it, not overcooked and 5 strips! the 2 eggs were full of yolk and also perfectly over EASY, served with rice and beans, just as I like it. The cook was generous enough to ADD some puerco a la chicana on top of my eggs, which was a pleasant surprise. I ordered a side beef enchilada just to sample their red enchilada sauce with my eggs. I requested some chips and salsa and was impressed by the flavor of the salsa which tasted FRESH. Add to that a stack of homemade corn tortillas nice and hot and this was sheer perfection for brunch on this day. Oh, and perhaps the BEST part for some of you was the PRICE! I expected to pay like $18 for all that, but when the bill came... ALL that LOVE and FLAVOR for under $10!!!???!!! Amazing!!! 5 Stars!!! :)
author: Ernest R.

description: i love this place and so does all my co-workers.  Everyone greets us as we walk in and no matter if you are ordering out or eating in i have always had the best food there...........this place is so good that i have even thought of driving in from the east bay on the weekend to get some food!  Fast service, great quality food, and the nicest people i have met in a long time!  My office goes there at least twice a week! this is REAL mexican food not the chains that are watered down for the mass market!
author: S M.

description: Man - talk about one of those places that you walk by all the time and never try, and then do and hate yourself for not doing so earlier!  My buddy and I were bored and lazy, so said 'want to try that place on the corner we always say we're gonna try?'....sooooo glad we did.  In addition to it being really damn cheap, the food was absolutely amazing (think tortillas fried fresh for an order of tacos, huge portions of everything, and high quality ingredients around), and the service was stupid good.  A guy who seemed to be in charge - Gallardo maybe? - even brought us a plate of braised pork spare ribs in a tomato-jalepeno sauce for free - and they were incredible.  So happy I found this place - doubt I'll be eating Mexican anywhere else!
author: Evan C.

description: 7 breakfast burritos - 7 people with food poisoning.  My colleague generously drive out from downtown to get our team breakfast burritos last Friday morning, that, while tasty, left everyone who ate them very sick for the next 24 hours.  Avoid.
author: Eoin O.

description:
OMGosh! OMGosh! OMGosh! I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place!  This place absolutely, hands down, has the BEST MEXICAN FOOD in this city! SIMPLY PUT...It's like eating my late Grandmother's homemade Mexican food and is absolutely fantastic!
I miss her homemade tortillas, refried beans and meat dishes, but this place brings back all those memories in the best way ever!

This place is not like the "fast food" taquerias all over the city in SF. It's a great casual sit down place, very clean, with lovely servers and friendly cooks in the kitchen! It's literally like sitting in my gram's kitchen for a wonderful meal. You asbsolutely have to try this place out!!! It's my favorite place to eat in San Francisco!

And...just for the record...I think the few people who gave bad reviews of this place, really need to go again or are just cranky people with a negative outlook is all I'm sayin!
author: Joseph G.

description:
Finally hit this spot with a few friends for breakfast at 10:00 am. I have been seeking a fabulous chilaquiles place in SF and am writing to report that I found an Ok chilaquiles place.  Gallardos is very familal in ambience, service, and its fellow patrons.  Traditional Mexican menu all around. They have a good number of the usual suspects for brunch.  The place seemed pretty clean.  I ordered the chilaquiles and Mexican hot chocolate.  My pals ordered the chorizo omelette and huevos rancheros.  The food arrived in record time.  The Mexican hot chocolate didn't taste very Mexican - no spice. The chilaquiles - the chip pieces were bigger than i like and there weren't enough eggs for me.  The flavor didn't have enough zing - the sauce that it is- - - maybe not homemade.  The rice and beans had some decent flavor.   My friends had never had Mexican breakfast before and both cleared their plates. We all liked the warm tortillas.  

There was a nice buzz in the place.  The soups all looked delicious.  The customers were mostly of seemingly Mexican descent and the place was pretty full  with regulars on a rainy Saturday morning. 

if in the hood, I'd go back and try the huevos with nopales or a taco at lunch.  All in all - not amazing, but worthy of a repeat looksey.
author: Carson R.

description: Gallardo's wins the award for most ill-placed sign ever...right behind a big huge tree.  I biked through 14th & Folsom every day and never even noticed there was a restaurant here.  But when you do go inside, you find a surprisingly large space decorated mostly with pictures from the Mexican silver screen (not too shabby).  I don't know of any "signature" dish here, but they did have a nopalitos con huevos burrito, and I've been meaning to try something with cactus for a long time, so I got it.  It was huge, but amazingly, it was gone before I knew it and I didn't even feel that stuffed, but when something's tasty and vegetarian, what do you expect?  In short, not a destination dive but a rock-solid option if you're in this (rather food-sparse) part of town.
author: Wes M.

description:
Pretty darn good but not awesome. The location is rather crappy, parking is a biotch! Also they do not have horchata, wtf? Aside from those two things this place serves up some serious Mexican comfort food. For appetizer we started with the Frijoles con queso, a yummy gooey platter of re fried beans with a ton of melted cheese, guac and grilled jalapenos. Gooey goodness! I had combo #5 a tostada and enchilada and the hubby combo #2 green sauce enchiladas. OMG more piled high goodness. The tostada was off the hook with meat, beans, guac and salsa. The hubby enjoyed the green sauce enchiladas so much he didn't want to share, lol! As others have mentioned the handmade corn tortillas are something special, large and tasty. I would return to this place again, I would love to try the soups. The service was nice and quick too. 
P.S. The chips and salsa are just ok, the salsa is on the spicy side. 
P.S.S. I love, love the Mexican movie star posters on all the walls. The gorgeous Maria Felix is always a wonderful site to see.
author: La C.

description: Best Mexican food in the Mission.  There I said it.  The albondigas are amazing.
author: Adam E.

description:
Absolutely recommend! I ate here for the first time a few weeks ago and don't have a single bad thing to say about the place: our waitress was funny and super nice and seemed sincere in her kindness and patience, the food rocked! and came in enormous portions and is very inexpensive along with the extensive menu (including loads of veggie options and a brunch). 

Regarding "going the extra mile"...Six of us showed up at 6:59 on a Thursday and had no clue they were actually about to close (at 7pm). They basically reopened the kitchen, turned on the music (my first clue) and brought us not just chips and dip to start but some crazy yummy bean and avocado appetizer (that we were not charged for). There was no rush, no irritation on their part for this big group barging in right before closing; we didn't get wind that they were actually closing until we noticed their hours posted in the corner of the window. Feeling horrible for being so unobservant, we apologized to our waitress and thanked them for staying open and told them we will definitely be back as regulars - their brunch menu was looking darn good too.
author: Julie J.

description: Excellent all around experience! Amazing authentic food and great service from kind individuals. The huevos rancheros and chilaquiles were wonderful. Strongly recommend having some Mexican hot chocolate (chocolate abuelita). One of the managers came over after our meal to see how everything was and he took his time and was genuinely interested in our feedback. During our breakfast a man playing the guitar came in and sang. It couldn't have been a more authentic Mexican experience if we'd been in Mexico! Don't judge a book by its cover- try it and you won't regret it.
author: Marianne C.

description: The menudo was out of this world!!! It is the best I have ever had. All of their soups are amazing. Their portions are big and fair. It is just absolutely delicious. The have fresh orange and carrot juice. You can mix them per request. They do not take credit cards at this moment, because their machine is broken. Most of the staff speaks broken English, but it is so worth it.
author: Angela Y.

description: I grew up in the Central Valley and fondly remember going to delicious, family owned Mexican restaurants where the chips were fresh, the salsa was hot, the tortillas were handmade, and after a few visits, you were part of the family. I haven't found anything that came close until breakfast this morning at Gallardos. I stumbled in after finding it on mobile.yelp.com (woo hoo!) and was so excited. My huevos rancheros were delicious, the tortillas were wonderful, and the carrot juice- yum. Musicians serenaded us as I ate my amazing breakfast. I cannot wait to return for dinner.
author: Noelle Q.

description: If you think good mexican food is chevy's or celia's sorry to tell you- you are very wrong. If you want to sit down and enjoy an authentic Mexican meal definitely go here. The portions are great and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  The sopes are good, the enchiladas are good...I could go on...
author: Valerie A.

description: I live around the corner and I go down probably, once every few months?  I like their food, and they are wonderful people, it's just the atmosphere is a little weird in there, I feel so alien when I walk in and sit down.  The food is good and dependable, the enchiladas are always done well and the interior, the wall to wall black and white still of latino movies is great.
author: Asha H.

description:
I have to admit I've only tried the albondigas soup...  I keep telling me myself next time I come here I'll order something else but it's sooo good that I end up getting the large albondigas soup again.

Large chunks of carrots, potatoes, and celery makes perfect companions for the large meatballs.  The broth is light yet very savory.  I like to add huge spoonfuls of parsley and onions to finish out the soup.
author: mellow p.

description: roaches - hoping you see this post  before you eat here. i will never forget my experience and the  roach!   while eating a bowl of  menudo my husband pointed to the wall behind me, i  turned to see what he was looking at, i  actually thought it was a bee but no it was a huge roach... i got up in a panic and told the guy at the counter, he grabbed a napkin and went and squished it on the wall, then threw it down his kitchen sink. i hope it was dead!  omg i thought i was going to have a heart attack, i said that outloud  ,and he said shall i call 911 - i said no but i know who i'll be calling the health dept!  just called to place the complaint.  do not go here unless you want to risk bringing  roaches home, or eating them urggg, yuck gross - the owner started to talk about me in spanish -saying shes never seen a roach in her life stupid white girl - and the answer would be no you nasty man i never had seen a roach before that is until i went to your restaurant, and i speak fluent spanish because i'm mexican!  yuck, groosssssssss  oh and mr smartypants owner said the roach came from next door because they don't have roaches, um yea....  ewwwwwweeeeee
author: Elsie G.

description: I live right next to Gallardos so naturally I want it to be my go-to spot for quick & easy pick-up. I continue to give them my business after many failed attempts of theirs to make me happy. I usually get the super chicken burrito and say however many times they request, that I do not want rice in it. It is a 50/50 chance my burrito will actually come without rice. Today the odds were not in my favor. I called and requested my order again which was very difficult for them to understand. I went to pick up my new burrito and the lady asked me where my old burrito was? I asked her if she really wanted me to go home and retrieve my burrito and she did. Did she think I was trying to scam them? Was she gonna reuse the chicken? I grabbed it and presented it unwrapped and 1/5th eaten in exchange for my 2nd burrito. It was still mediocre as usual and I can't stand the two handfuls of big pieces of lettuce they include. I am sad to say I continue to try my hardest to never have to eat here. I miss San Diego's Mexican food :(
author: Jessica Y.

description: This place is across the street fromn me and I really like it. The breakfasts are $6.75 and more than filling. The place is deceptively large and covered with these great large photos of mexican movie stars. The staff is very friendly and It is a family run place. The food is very fresh. Good takeout too. Great hangover location.
author: Julian M.

description: Mmmmm... I love their food here.  Price is decent and the platter is HUGE.  Everything is so flavorful and u also get salsa and chips while you wait.  This place is located right across the street from Foods Co.  It's a bit hidden in front of a bus stop.  $10 will get you a platter of refried beans a taco and enchilada.  It's delicious!
author: Mimi S.

description:
good service
dry, nasty, did I say DRY? carnitas in the enchilada
I dont think it was a good experience and suggest you go into the mission further. Like El Faro or El Toro.
author: Razza M.

description:
OK, I REALLY want to like this place, so I'm giving it 3 stars.

The atmosphere is great - huge framed photo stills from old '40s Mexican movies cover the walls. You feel like you're in Mexico City, at some restaurant that caters to middle-class Mexicans.

The food just misses.

The salsa is a little too tame, the chips a little too greasy.

The chicken in the chicken enchiladas is EXCELLENT!!! If only the tortillas surrounding the chicken weren't so greasy (my Mexican grandmother would have told them that the oil they cooked them in wasn't hot enough). And I like cheese as much as the next guy, but they smother the enchiladas, beans and salad (with 1000 island dressing) with it, topped with sour cream. All these toppings don't do justice to the excellent chicken, rice and beans underneath.

Listen up, people! Mexicans use cheese sparingly, if at all, and even less cream! This place uses cheese & cream like some bad Italian restaurant in 1980s Ohio! 

The daily special I had yesterday was "pollo con verdudas". "Muy rico" said the waitress. Well, it was my gringa mom's DULL chicken stew with carrots, potatoes and celery, not a hint of herbs, spices, peppers or tomato.

Tortillas are probably regional, but for me I found them a little too course and heavy.

The service is friendly, fast & efficient considering one waitress has to serve 2 huge rooms.
author: John G.

description: I stopped in at Gallardo's yesterday after a dance class. I was starving and had wanted to try their food. It was great. I ordered the cheese enchiladas which come with rice and beans and yummy green salsa. Many locals eat here. The service is friendly and quick. The prices are reasonable - $8.50 for this delicious meal. I will definitely be back to try the posole, etc. Also liked the photos lining the walls.
author: Roseann G.

description: follow the leader...unlikely find...across familiar nihon whiskey...enter gallardos...following advise...a trial and hope for no error....aged, but seemingly pleasant....greet and seat....smile and menu....already noticing a twist and variation to mexican menu....omelettes, scrambles and soups, and pancakes?!?...new to mexican breakfast and quick glancing around....what to order?....radar around...seeing scrambles, soup bowls gigante, pancakes...being safe and breakfast burrito trial....large platter weigh heavy....spoon salsa picante only option....meat and eggs filled....meat and egg heavy...scarce beans or extra filling....perfecto!...meaty egg burrito worthy of second visit.....a second visit within one week period....pancakes and scrambles next....standard american pancake thick chew great....lather syrup and butter pasting...mm...chorizo scramble bit dry while other scrambles looking finer....note for future order....steaming hot tortilla wrapping, beaning, ricing, lettucing and salsa'ing...bite and filling meal..worthy of third visit....soup next!
author: Hen A.

description: Ok peeps... this place is dee-lish! I am Mexican-American and am so PICKY with my Mexican food. I am lucky to say that my mom still cooks authentic Mexican meals 7 days a week sooo it's easy to compare the authentic to wannbe... Anywho... their enchiladas de pollo or queso are the bomb. chile verde is one of my favorites. Had their pozole today! SOpa de rez, just like my mommas, fajitas are very flavorful and healthy, home made tortillas to die for, beans and jalapenos are cooked with manteca (tastes like it mmmmm :) the only down side is they dont have agua fresca.. just fresh squeezed oj and carrot juice...their birria is good. my dad orders birria when we go here... lets see what else...carne asada is very flavorful... albondigas are yumm-o... cant go wrong here... good luck ya'all.. oh and dont try to go for dinner.. its just breakfast and lunch !
author: lupita r.

description: OMG, Must try their beef or chicken soup, so good especially in the winter, and their salsa is awesome!!! Too bad they close sooo early...
author: Amy C.

description: We've been having lunch here for about 14years.  The food is very good and prices are very reasonable!!  However there is no alcohol served here.  They even serve breakfast.. the omellets are fantastic!
author: Catherine H.

description: Bland decor/ambiance....but that doesn't matter because you just need to order, eat and leave....huge portions of tasty, homemade mexican food. Had the seafood enchiladas....stuffed full of lobster, shrimp, and crab....red sauce with American cheese on top which seemed strange, but it totally works....dee-lish. Love to eat here when I'm in this part of the city.
author: EStar M.

description: i could not believe what reviewer fallopian swim team d. said about this restaurant.  i grew up eating mexican food that my grandmother cooked and i can tell you this is good food.  the portions are more then generous, the owner juan has really built up the business and has a large following.  as far as menudo, its good and certainly doesn't smell like old socks. i always recommend this restaurant especially for breakfast.
author: PATRICIA A.
